Title: Coronavirus: Four Wuhan students return after two weeks in isolation
Content:
Representative Image

(With inputs from Abdul Qadir)

PATNA/GAYA: Altogether 42 students from Bihar, who had returned from Wuhan in China and were quarantined in Gurugram for two weeks, have now started returning home.Four medical students from Madhubani, who were studying in Wuhan — the city worst-hit by the Coronavirus in China — returned home on Wednesday after completing the incubation period. Health officials said they will be monitored for another 14 days as a precautionary measure.“The students have been given the contact number of SHO’s in their respective districts. The four Madhubani residents informed us about their condition as soon as they returned. We are keeping a track on the other students, too, who will return in a day or two,” said state surveillance officer Dr Ragini Mishra.She added: “They have been advised isolation at home and our medical teams will monitor them for a period of 14 days. Thereafter, if we find any symptomatic patient, we will send their samples to National Institute of Virology (NIV), Pune.”Meanwhile, two patients were admitted to the isolation ward of Anugraha Narayan Magadh Medical College and Hospital (ANMMCH) in Gaya on Friday, for possible exposure to the deadly disease.A 20-year-old youth from Manpur locality in Gaya was admitted on Wednesday. The youth who is pursuing a course in Chinese language returned to his hometown from China on January 11.Gaya civil surgeon Dr BK Singh said the youth evaded scanning at Gaya airport and somehow managed to go home. “He is suffering from cold, cough and fever, which are the three main symptoms of the virus that has caused havoc in China. His sample has been sent for test to NIV and he will remain in the isolation ward until we get his reports,” he said.“Similarly, samples of a Burmese traveller with similar symptoms of the deadly disease, who was admitted in the isolation ward of ANMMCH, has also been sent to NIV,” said Mishra.Earlier, health officials established a 20-bed isolation ward to quarantine coronavirus suspects. The civil surgeon claimed that the isolation ward has all the necessities, including biological mask for health workers and single personal protection kits. Besides, health staffs deputed at the airport and the isolation ward are under strict instruction to maintain hygiene,” he added.

Title: No HC relief for disqualified directors
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

(Representative image)

MUMBAI: The Bombay high court has in an interim order declined to stay a 2017 circular issued by the corporate affairs ministry and granted no relief to directors of various companies against disqualification due to failure in filing of returns. The circular was a list of directors who were disqualified for non-filing of returns of their respective companies.

The HC was of the prima facie opinion that, regarding the re-appointment of a director of a company that “has not filed financial statements or annual returns for any continuous period of three financial years, would mean that the person can continue…till the end of the extant term, but would not be eligible for re-appointment for another five years thereafter, then, there is sufficient opportunity to enable him to correct the affairs of that company.”

So if the company in which the person is or has been a director has not filed financial statements or annual returns for any continuous period of three financial years on the date on which the company fails to do so, a disqualification is incurred. It is a ministerial or administrative act of filing that is to be performed by the company.

Therefore, if such financial statements or annual returns for any continuous period of three financial years have not been filed, then the action is triggered, said the HC bench of Justices S C Dharmadhikari and Riyaz Chagla in a February 7 order, uploaded recently.

The HC clarified, however, that “if such a director had been appointed within six months of the company becoming a defaulting company, he would not incur disqualification”. “It is clear that section 164 of the Companies Act, 2013 provides for disqualifications for appointment of director,” said the HC bench, rejecting prayers for interim relief as sought by the directors. “We do not think that the interim relief as sought can be granted. A blanket stay or a relief having far-reaching legal consequences as sought cannot be granted,” said the bench.

The order was passed in a batch of around 70 matters tagged and heard together. Some petitions were filed in 2018. The main plea according to the additional solicitor general (ASG) was “virtually to stay the operation, enforcement and effect of the law itself”. “The petitioners were asking the HC to go into the issue of the individual directors’ disqualification and, in that process, the court is requested to virtually re-write the section,” argued the Centre’s ASG Anil Singh.

The directors who had moved court relied on judgments passed by the high courts of Gujarat, Delhi, Telangana, Madras and Allahabad to argue that the list of September 2017 cannot have a retrospective effect or could not have been implemented prior to October 2017 as was sought to be done. But the Centre said that if returns are not filed continuously for a period of three years, then disqualification is invited.

The HC said after having also heard Cyrus Ardeshir, Zal Andhyarujina and some other counsels for the directors, an earlier order it had passed in October 2019 raising legal queries “sufficiently protects the interest of both sides”. The matters will be finally heard to decide particularly the Constitutional challenge raised against the law.

Title: Bihar DGP Gupteshwar Pandey to launch women safety app on February 27
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Bihar DGP Gupteshwar Pandey

PATNA: Bihar DGP Gupteshwar Pandey will launch a mobile application, ‘ Hello Di-Di ’, at the police headquarters here on February 27 to ensure safety of women, ADG (headquarters) Jitendra Kumar said on Wednesday.

Jitendra said specific information about the mobile app would be provided on the day of its launch. “The mobile app for women safety has been developed by a private IT solution firm. It will be the first-of-its-kind app in the state aimed at ensuring women safety,” he said.

The ADG added that if a woman senses danger, she can raise an alarm by using the mobile app. “They can press the panic button which will automatically send the information to police control room. Accordingly, the police will act to offer help to the women in danger,” Jitendra said.

He said the women can also lodge complaint through the app and police personnel will take necessary action.

Women will be required to download the app on their cellphones and fill the details, such address and phone numbers of family and friends who can be contacted in case of emergency.

Meanwhile, women in Patna have expressed happiness over the launch of the app. Medha Shree, a student of Magadh Mahila College, said with rise in crime against women, such measures were the need of the hour. “It is the responsibility of the state government to provide safe environment to girls,” she said.

However, Sonali Kumari, a student of J D Women’s College, said Patna Municipal Corporation had launched a similar mobile app about a year ago, but it failed. “I just hope the new app will work so that women feel safe in the city,” she said.

Title: Tejas to CM: Don’t harp on liquor ban, listen to DGP
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

PATNA: Two days after DGP Gupteshwar Pandey spoke sternly on sale of liquor in the state and involvement of cops in it, leader of opposition in state assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav on Wednesday took a dig at CM Nitish Kumar, asking him to listen to the top cop instead of “giving sermons on liquor ban”.

Tejashwi said ever since total prohibition was enforced in Bihar, a parallel nexus of police, administration and bootleggers has been at work in the state.

He added, “What we have been saying on liquor ban stands vindicated today. Do we say more when the DGP himself admits bootlegging is rampant in Bihar with blessing of police, ruling politicians and administration? Prohibition remains a grandiose PR (public relations) exercise by Nitish ji. Unmasking has begun now.”

The DGP had stirred a controversy last Sunday when he held thanedars (incharge of police stations) and chowkidars (village informers) — two grassroots level functionaries of the state administration — responsible for smuggling of illicit liquor in ‘dry’ state.

Pandey, known for his controversial statements, had said at a function in Aurangabad on Sunday that prohibition in the state would be a complete success only when the thanedars and chowkidars support it.

The DGP had said that liquor was sold and transported from one place to another with the tacit support of the incharge of police stations concerned and the chowkidars in the villages and panchayats. “If they are not aware of the happenings around — whether good or bad — under their jurisdiction, they have no right to continue at their respective posts,” he had told the gathering.

He had also said that the bootleggers can’t operate without the support of the police. “The quantum of liquor recovery in the last four years has indicated that a well-oiled syndicate is active. There is an urgent need to strike at the root of the problem,” he had said, adding the erring cops won’t be spared.

The DGP had also issued stern warning to people for violating provisions of the Bihar Excise and Prohibition Act 2016. “Those cops found to be lax in implementing the provisions of prohibition will be sent to jail. Kanoon sabke liye barabar hai (all are equal in the eyes of law),” he had said.

Reacting to the DGP’s statement, Bihar Police Association state president Mritunjay Kumar Singh said it was true that some policemen were involved in liquor sale. “Action should be taken against the erring cops. But the entire police force should not be blamed or questioned and that too from a public forum,” he added.

Title: Young netas take lead as yatras gain momentum
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

PATNA: With assembly elections barely few months away, yatras by netas have gathered pace in the state. Senior leaders of prominent political parties, especially the new generation leaders, have planned to embark on separate yatras to gauge the mood of voters and consolidate their support base.

While the RJD’s CM face and leader of opposition in state assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav (30) has decided to undertake a statewide ‘Berozgaari Hatao Yatra’ from February 23, Lok Janshakti Party (LJP) chief and Jamui MP Chirag Paswan (37) will embark on ‘Bihar First-Bihari First Yatra’ from February 21.

Former JNUSU president and CPI functionary Kanhaiya Kumar (33) is already visiting different parts of the state as part of his month-long ‘Jan Gan Man Yatra’ against CAA, NRC and NPR. Congress MLA from Kadwan (Katihar) and former student leader of the JNU Shakeel Ahmad Khan is also accompanying Kanhaiya in the yatra.

Tejashwi’s ‘Berozgaari Hatao Yatra’ has already generated much heat in the state’s political circles. While a few legislators of the ruling JD(U) have welcomed the RJD leader’s initiative to highlight the burning issue of unemployment and migration, the BJP leaders have said Tejashwi is taking out the yatra to end his own ‘berozgaari’.

“Tejashwi himself is unemployed these days. Hence, he has decided to undertake this yatra. His family had made lakhs of youths unemployed during 15-year RJD rule in the state,” Union minister of state for health and Buxar MP Ashwini Kumar Choubey said.

Tejashwi has also hired a swanky air-conditioned bus for his yatra which will begin from Veterinary College’s ground in Patna on February 23. The bus had hit headlines after JD(U) leader and state’s information and public relations minister Neeraj Kumar alleged that it was registered in the name of a person from BPL category.

“Tejashwi undertook some political yatras in the past also. But he could not complete any of his yatra,” JD(U) leader and state’s building construction minister Ashok Choudhary told TOI.

LJP spokesperson Shravan Kumar Agarwal said Chirag would cover at least two districts each day as part of his yatra beginning from February 21. “On the first day, he will visit Muzaffarpur and Vaishali,” Agarwal said, adding Chirag will visit different parts of the state to invite people to participate in the party’s proposed state-level rally at Patna’s Gandhi Maidan on April 14.

Besides these young leaders, CM Nitish Kumar had also finished his ‘Jal Jivan Hariyali Yatra’ in the second week of January this year. He had visited all 38 districts as part of his yatra to spread awareness about environment protection and impact of climate change.

Title: Home secy finds CAG report incorrect
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: Dismissing the comptroller and auditor general ( CAG )’s observations of irregularities, additional chief secretary (home and vigilance) Vishwas Mehta gave a clean-chit to the police department on Wednesday.

Chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan, on Tuesday, had asked Mehta for a report on the irregularities—the CAG had pointed out—in utilizing central funds.

Contradicting the CAG report, Mehta’s report said physical verification had found that none of the Indian small arms system (Insas) rifles had gone missing. Clerical errors in various registers at the police chief store and other units had given rise to such a suspicion.

Besides launching a formal investigation, it has also been decided to computerize the details of arms and ammunitions, the report said.

Regarding the audit remark that vehicles were purchased for use by senior officers ignoring operational needs of police stations, the home secretary said the acquired vehicles, such as Toyota Innova, were operational ones and have been allotted to units such as those on highway patrol.

The secretary also pointed out that senior officers, too, participated in such operations.

Refuting allegations of shortage of vehicles at police stations, the secretary’s report said the CAG’s findings were incorrect.

Mehta’s report also justified the purchase of various equipment through Keltron—allegedly in violation of store purchase manual and central vigilance commission guidelines. He reported that it was unfair on the part of the CAG to be critical of Keltron, a total solution provider for several departments.

The state police chief was not wrong in instructing to purchase tablets for vehicle-mounted GPS systems from Panasonic, Mehta said.

The Japanese electronics major enjoyed 65% of market share in the segment, and the other two companies in the same space—Gtec and DT Research—have no service centres in the country, the report said.

Considering the security aspect, it was justifiable to purchase bullet-proof vehicles for VVIPs through limited tender process, the report added.

Justifying the construction of villas for the state police chief and ADGPs, Mehta’s report said the funds sanctioned in 2013-14 for upper subordinate quarters were not utilized till 2017-18. The funds were on the verge of getting lapsed even after it was granted through supplementary demands for grants. The secretary said since the funds, by then, were insufficient for construction of quarters for subordinate officers, and it was decided to construct villas before the allocation period lapsed.

Meanwhile, questioning the authority of home secretary to whitewash the adverse findings of CAG, opposition leader Ramesh Chennithala said the public would reject Mehta’s report. He was speaking after visiting the state police chief’s official residence. The was based on the CAG report that the funds were diverted to construct the villa.

Title: MBBS student alleges ragging on UGC helpline
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

An inquiry was conducted by dean Dr Jayesh Brahmbhatt and other officials of GMC, but they found no student be... Read More

Surat: Anti Ragging Cell (ARC) set up by the University Grants Commission received an anonymous complaint of alleged ragging by a first year MBBS student of a government medical college.

The college’s anti ragging committee probed into the complaint on Wednesday and found that no student was ragged and some student must have filed the online complaint for fear of possible harassment.

ARC received the complaint on mail and the college was sent details of the allegations levelled by the student. The college authorities treated it as an anonymous complaint and top officials questioned a few students privately. However, no one has come forward with any complaint so far.

The complaint was filed on February 15 and a meeting of the college's anti ragging committee was held on Wednesday. An inquiry was done by dean Dr Jayesh Brahmbhatt and other officials of GMC but found no no student of being harassed.

In the complaint the first year MBBS student alleged that, “I was asked to come to the playground on the GMC campus at Majura Gate after college hours. I did not go as the seniors were making junionrs clean and level the ground and work like labourers. The students were being asked to carry soil in buckets. The ground is being prepared for some event."

The student, who requested the ARC not to identify him, further alleged that, "Those who did not go to work in the ground were identified by the seniors who kept a watch at the entry of the hostel and then forcibly took the absent students to the ground and made them work till 2 am. Those who did not cooperate were again called to work at 7 am in the morning."

The complainant named two seniors and alleged that they are involved in harassing the students and also submitted screenshots of the text message on WhatsApp in which the first year students were asked to come to the sports ground.

"The WhatsApp messages that were submitted as evidence were sent by first year students to their batchmates and not by seniors. When checked it was a general call for all those who wish to participate in preparations for the sports events," said Jayesh Brahmbhatt, dean, GMC.

"When I checked, no first year student confirmed harassment even in private. Further, the anonymous complainant is not claiming that he has been harassed but is claiming of noticing harassment of others. The committee found that it was a more a complaint out of panic by some student," said Brahmbhatt.

"I was part of the meeting and based on the discussion over findings it seems that the incident is not of nature of ragging. No one confirmed of harassment and it is a group activity," said a police officer of Khatodara police station.

Title: Weavers ask PM not to impose anti-dumping duty on nylon yarn
Content: Surat: The Federation of Gujarat Weavers Association (FOGWA) and the South Gujarat Warp Knitters Association have jointly urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi to stop the process of anti-dumping duty on nylon filament yarn taken up by the Directorate General of Trade Remedies (DGTR) as the import of yarn from Asia, especially China In a letter to PM on Wednesday, the FOGWA and warp knitters have stated that the coronavirus epidemic has stalled the imports of yarn, which is the key raw material for the powerloom sector, from China and other Asian countries. This has resulted in the domestic yarn spinners increasing the prices of yarn by 15% in the last one week.Ashish Gujarati, president of Pandesara weavers association said, “There is an extra demand in the market as the cheap import of fabric has been disrupted from China. But, the weavers are unable to produce more fabric as the prices of nylon yarn have increased. It is likely that the spinners may increase the prices further.”Further, powerloom weavers stated that about 6,500 metric tonnes of yarn is consumed by the nylon weavers in the city per month, out of which about 1,000 metric tonnes of yarn is imported from China per month.Talking with TOI, president of FOGWA, Ashok Jirawala said, “We have urged the PM to stop imposing anti-dumping duty on imported yarn from China in the wider interest of the powerloom sector.”President of South Gujarat Warp Knitters association, Brijesh Gondaliya said, “In the last one week, domestic yarn prices have increased by almost 15% per kilogram as the supplies from China has been affected.”

Title: Letter campaign starts for toll tax relief
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Surat: The Bhatia Toll Naka Sangarsh Samiti has launched a letter campaign demanding relief for the vehicles registered in the city and district from paying toll at the Bhatia toll plaza located on the Surat-Palsana Highway starting from Wednesday.

Since the last fortnight, farmers and cooperative leaders have organized a series of meetings in villages and talukas in Kamrej, Palsana, Choriyasi and Bardoli for garnering support of the residents, farmers, dairy organization, trade and industry to support the fight for the toll tax relief at the Bhatia toll plaza.

According to the members of the Bhatia Toll Naka Sangarsh Samiti, the letter campaign targets senior ministers in the central government, bureaucrats and ministers of Gujarat state for the toll tax relief at Bhatia toll plaza.

Darshan Naik, member of the sangarsh samiti, said, “Before we start the agitation at the Bhatia Toll Plaza, we want to inform the ministers and bureaucrats about our genuine demand for giving relief to the vehicles registered in the city and district.”

Naik added, “The toll rates for the local vehicles at the Bhatia toll plaza was fixed in March-2019 and the due date for revision after one year is nearing. We want the government to grant a complete exemption to the vehicles registered in the city from paying toll tax at Bhatia toll plaza.”

Prakash Contractor, president of Parivartan Trust, said, “The people in the district have supported our fight against the toll tax. Daily, hundreds of people have to wait in the long queues to pay the tax. More than 15,000 vehicles from the city and the district pass from Bhatia toll plaza. We have demanded a complete relief from paying the tax.”

Title: Jharkhand’s tribal killings bring spotlight on ‘Satipati movement’
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Seven people were beheaded in Jharkhand village in January

Surat: The brutal killings of seven people at Burugulikera village of Jharkhand in January has brought focus back on Satipati movement which has roots in Gujarat.

Jharkhand Janadhikar Mahasabha, a civil rights organization made up of several tribal rights groups, came up with a fact-finding report with regard to the beheading of seven people at Burugulikera in West Singhbhum district. The report claims that the killings were an outcome of the growing influence of 'Satipati cult' in Jharkhand.

However, those associated with the movement claim that Satipati movement’s objective is to protect nature and tribal rights and it does not believe in violence.

Former office-bearers of the movement in south Gujarat claimed that till date none of its members has ever been found involved in violence anywhere. Satipati movement denounces government of India and has its own seal and stamp. Its followers do not accept laws of the land, but their involvement has not been found in any violent activity so far.

Sources say that the Satipati movement among tribals is gaining ground in districts of South Gujarat. It has presence in tribal dominated villages in Tapi, Dangs and Valsad districts.

They further added that the origin of this group traces to Katasvan village in Vyara taluka of Tapi district in South Gujarat. Kunwar Keshri Singh was the founder of the group.

“Initial media reports indicated pro-pathalgadi faction in the village had murdered members of anti-pathalgadi faction for opposing its movement. To understand the role of Pathalgadi in the killings, a fact-finding team comprising activists, writers and journalists associated with Jharkhand Janadhikar Mahasabhha and owing allegiance to Adivasi Buddhijivi Manch, Adivasi Adhikar Manch, Adiwasi Women’s Network, National Alliance of People’s Movement (NAPM), Johar, Marxist Coordination Committee and Ulgulan Sena visited Burugulikera,” reads a statement by the fact-finding team.

“The fact-finding team found more than half of the total number of families in the village were followers of anti-Christ kutumb pariwar, also known as Satipati cult. The cult led by Ranasi Budh and a few others are accused of killing James Budh and six others of the village. The cult, active in the village for the past one year, had asked people to submit their ration cards, Aadhaar cards and voter cards and stop use of all government schemes,” the statement reads.

Pathalgadi is a traditional practice of Munda Adivasis where they erect stone slabs (pathals) in honour of their ancestors or to simply mark village boundary.

“Local media had published police's claim that the killings were result of a clash between supporters of Pathalgadi and those against it. However, the fact-finding team found involvement of Satipati cult followers in the killings,” said Aloka Kujur, convener of NAPM Jharkhand.

The current movement leaders refuse to speak to media.

WHAT IS SATIPATI MOVEMENT?

Founded by Kesari Singh almost four decades ago to assert tribal rights and their identity, the system denounces government of India. It has its own seal and stamp. Its followers do not accept laws of the land and keep their own identity cards. In many pockets, they do not take benefits of government scheme or even in some cases, do not vote in elections. However, their leaders deny having any links with violence in Jharkhand incident or elsewhere.

Title: Surat airport to host AAI kho-kho tournament
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Surat: The Surat airport authorities has organized regional ‘kho-kho’ tournament of the western region of Airports Authority of India (AAI) on Thursday.

Official said that this is first time that such a tournament has been organized at the airport to promote the domestic games. Players from the western region of AAI including Mumbai, Jalgaon, Gondia, Kandla, Keshod, Jabalpur, Ahmedabad and Vadodara will be participating in the tournament.

Around six teams, including two teams of women players, will play.

Airport director Aman Saini said, “This is first time that Surat airport has been selected by the sports division of AAI for hosting the kho-kho tournament. We have invited golden girl Sarita Gaekwad from Dang as the chief guest.”

Saini added, “All the players are employees of the AAI and serving at various stations in the western region. We have kept the tournament open for the visitors to watch.” ”

Title: Hyundai to open 70 rural workshops this year
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Chennai: Hyundai Motor India has said it will open 70 workshops in smaller towns and cities this year.

Currently it has 1329 service outlets countrywide.

“This year we will be focusing on rural reach. Whatever expansion of our service network we have planned will all be in rural markets only. Right now 387 out of a total of 1,329 outlets are in tier 4 markets and by 2020 end we will add another 70 to this tally, ”said S Punnaivanam, national service head, HMI.

Apart from setting up new service points in rural markets, HMI is also introducing other options for rural customers. One of them is two-wheeler based service assistance.

“Countrywide we have 510 such two wheeler service points,” said Punnaivanam.

“These bikes go from the main dealer outlets which are the hubs to spoke markets in a radius of 25-30 km.”

HMI is also getting its network ready for electric vehicles.

“We have identified 34 workshops where the technicians are trained to service electric vehicles,” he said .

Title: Analytics, big data courses see 4x jump in weightage on demand from BFSI sector
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Chennai: With growing demand for better and efficient customer services in the BFSI sector, analytics and big data training institutions have recorded an average of 4x rise in the weightage of courses offered with newer AI and ML-driven tools and skills.

Gaurav Vohra, co-founder and CEO, Jigsaw Academy, said, “Weightage from traditional statistical algorithms towards newer demand for Machine Learning (ML) algorithms has increased from 10% to 50% in the last 5 years in the courses we offer. While, weightage for open source tools has moved from 5% to 60% in the same period.”

Even when open source analytical toll turned popular, BFSI was the last industry to jump on that bandwagon. Vohra said, “So, even five years before they were continuing to use proprietary paid expensive analytical tools for lot of their analysis and their inter-management. Only in the last five years, there are actually moving towards open source tools, and adoption of big data technology.”

The BFSI sector witnesses more reliability on ML algorithms to support operations like credit risk, KYC norms.

upGrad co-founder Mayank Kumar said, “We have seen 5x increase in the weightage for courses offered for BFSI sector. In reality, BFSI sector started using data science way earlier, unlike other ecosystem today. One of the kind of work we do at BFSI- visualization and driving insights. Data science tool on prediction, upselling, cross selling of financial products and also to check on fraudulent activities. If one applies for a savings account, then with that data the bank tries to push an insurance for the family.” Agencies are witnessing a churn in course content too. Hari Krishnan Nair, co-founder of Great Learning said, “From offering two or three program matching the skill demand in the BFSI sector, we now offer about 15 courses. About 25% of our course structure gets revised every year to match the constantly changing demand from the market.” To improve customer service insurance company Bajaj Allianz General Insurance had introduced AI-driven Motor On The Spot (Motor OTS) facility for private car owning customers, where it capitalizes on huge and rich repository of loss data available with the organization. With this move, the insurer had settled over 10,000 claims, with a turnaround time reduced to 30 minutes, thus reducing the hassles of document in-warding and claim registration.

Title: Gujarat to soon roll out new software for organ registry
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Representative image

SURAT: Organ donation is all set to get a boost with the State Organ and Tissue Transplant Organization (SOTTO) deciding design new software for maintaining an organ registry .

SOTTO was set up to ensure that organ donation and transplantation process becomes transparent on all fronts. Institute of Kidney Diseases and Research Center (IKDRC), Ahmedabad was designated as Center for SOTTO for effective implantation of the programme and for promoting organ sharing and regulating the transplantation of human organs in the state.

“The new software is being designed by central government’s National Informatics Centre (NIC) and it will cater as one step solution for everything related to cadaver donations,” said Dr. Pranjal Modi, head, Transplant and Surgery department at IKDRC and SOTTO convenor.

“Everything detail will available online. The waiting list of all potential organ recipients for heart, lungs, liver, pancreas, kidneys and other organs will be computerised,” he added.

The software will have all the details about retrieval medical centres, waiting list of patients, transplantation centres to name a few.

“The trail run of the software is underway and will soon be rolled out. The software will have some information for general public while most information will be only for registered medical centers,” Modi added.

According to sources, in 2019, 389 kidney transplantations were done at IKRDC which included 96 cadaver transplantation and rest were living transplantation. Similarly, 68 liver transplantation were carried out of which 52 were cadaver donations.

Title: Facebook leads $110 million funding in Unacademy
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

(File photo)

BENGALURU: Education technology startup Unacademy has raised $110 million in a new round of funding led by social networking giant Facebook , private equity firm General Atlantic and existing backer Sequoia Capital India.

The five-year-old startup, which links educators giving lessons to students through online videos for competitive exams, is expected to be valued at $500 million in the new round.

The new round of funding signifies the increasing attractiveness of the education technology sector and also Unacademy, which had closed its previous round of funding in June. That round of $50 million was led by Hong Kong-based hedge fund Steadview Capital and valued the company at over $200 million.

The deal is Facebook’s second bet on a startup in India after it backed Meesho, a social commerce player that leverages the Silicon Valley-based social networking giants’ application WhatsApp.

For General Atlantic, this would be the second major education technology bet in India after Byju’s, which is valued at $8 billion.

Unacademy was founded by Gaurav Munjal, who sold his first startup Flatchat to Commonfloor, along with Hemesh Singh (former CTO at Flatchat) and former IAS officer Roman Saini. Its existing investors already include SAIF Partners, Nexus Venture Partners and Blume Ventures. Individual investors include Flipkart CEO Kalyan Krishnamurthy, Sujeet Kumar (co-founder, Udaan) and Haptik’s Aakrit Vaish.

In February last year, the startup had launched its paid subscription programme — Unacademy Plus — which Munjal recently said in a tweet that it has reached $30 million in annualised recurring revenues (ARR). The startup has more than 90,000 active subscribers, with 70% coming from tier-2 and -3 cities.

The capital will be used by Unacademy to expand into new categories, expand its educator base of 10,000 and invest in product and technology.“We started monetising last year in February with Rs 2 crore a month and have now reached about Rs 18 crore, which is about a 9x growth. The growth has been coming from across all major exams like UPSC, IIT-JEE and Bank PO,” said Munjal. The startup said it has 150 million monthly views on its own platform and its channels on YouTube.

Title: Sanofi ties up with US for virus vaccine
Content: Mumbai: Sanofi Pasteur , the vaccines business unit of Sanofi, will leverage previous development work for a SARS vaccine to fast-track development of a Covid-19 vaccine. The company will collaborate with Biomedical Advanced Research and Development Authority (BARDA), part of the office of the assistant secretary for preparedness and response, at the US department of health.Covid-19 belongs to a family of coronaviruses that can cause respiratory disease.In 2002, the SARS (severe acute respiratory syndrome) coronavirus emerged and then disappeared by 2004. Sanofi plans to investigate an advanced pre-clinical SARS vaccine candidate that could protect against Covid-19. “Addressing a global health threat such as this coronavirus is going to take a collaborative effort, which is why we are working with BARDA to quickly advance a potential vaccine candidate,” said David Loew, global head of vaccines at Sanofi. “While we are lending our expertise where possible, we believe the collaboration with BARDA may provide the most meaningful results in protecting the public from this latest outbreak.” The company will use its recombinant DNA platform to produce a vaccine candidate. agencies The recombinant technology produces an exact genetic match to proteins found on the surface of the virus. The DNA sequence encoding this antigen will be combined into the DNA of the baculovirus expression platform, the basis of Sanofi’s licensed recombinant influenza product, and used to rapidly produce large quantities of the coronavirus antigen which will be formulated to stimulate the immune system to protect against the virus.Earlier it had entered into an agreement with HHS to increase the company’s pandemic influenza vaccine production, capabilities based in Pennsylvania.

Title: AMU students condemn Yogi’s statement, demand resignation
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Agra: The students of Aligarh Muslim University (AMU) on Wednesday demanded immediate resignation of UP CM Yogi Adityanath for his statement in the Vidhan Sabha. In his statement, CM Yogi held students responsible for the violence during anti-CAA protests on December 15.

Students said, “CM’s remark that AMU students used stones, petrol bombs and weapons against police is false.”

“The CM is trying to skirt the terror unleashed against the students of AMU on the fateful night. After seeing the photographs of the clash between AMU students and police, Allahabad High Court Chief Justice Govind Mathur said that police made a war-like situation,” former students union president Salman Imtiaz said.

“We urge the President of India to take notice of his false claims and seek his removal,” students said.

Former members of AMU Students’ Union urged the judiciary to look into the matter and save the lives of citizens and their right to protest. The students urged the judiciary to take a serious note of Yogi’s statement.

Title: Shahar Qazi skips court hearing, asked to appear on Monday
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Bhopal/Jabalpur: Secretary of Bhopal Masajid Committee, S M Salman, appeared before a division bench of M P high court on Wednesday but Bhopal Shahar Qazi didn’t turn up. Both of them were asked to be personally present in the court on Wednesday by the division bench of Justice Sanjay Yadav and Justice Atul Sreedharan in connection with a contempt petition.

When the court expressed displeasure over Shahar Qazi’s absence, it was informed that the train he was scheduled to board at Bhopal for Jabalpur was cancelled at the last minute because of non-interlocking work being carried out near Jabalpur. The court, then, asked Salman and Shahar Qazi, Mushtaq Ali Nadvi to appear in court on Monday.

The contempt petition filed by Mohd. Wasim Khan contended that Bhopal Masajid Committee and Shahar Qazi had committed contempt of court by not discontinuing the practice of hearing marital disputes of Muslim couples and passing orders in cases where separation, divorce or any other relief may have been sought. This despite the high court order on a petition filed in 2009-10 by Mohd. Zakir Khan, seeking a ban on ‘parallel’ court run by the Bhopal Masajid Committee and the Shahar Qazi. The court had allowed the petition and ordered ban on this practice but it is still continuing.

The court had asked the Shahar Qazi and secretary of Bhopal Masajid Committee to be present in court during the hearing of the petition on Wednesday.

Title: UIDAI wants 400 Aadhaar cards deactivated in Telangana
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Picture used for representational purpose only

HYDERABAD: The Hyderabad office of the Unique Identity Authority of India (UIDAI) has recommended deactivation of some 400 Aadhaar cards across Telangana in past one year. The authority had sent the card-holders notices after receiving complaints that they had obtained the card on false pretences. Many of these people were untraceable or had not responded to the notice, while others have presented their case before the authorities.

UIDAI has made the recommendation at a time when there is a raging controversy over 87 residents in the Old City receiving notices over complaints that they were not Indian citizens or had obtained the Aadhaar card falsely.

“We regularly inquire into complaints of an applicant obtaining an Aadhaar card with fake documents or fake biometrics. We receive complaints against enrolment agencies and operators as well. If we don’t get a proper explanation from the card-holder, we recommend deactivation,” an official told TOI.

Final decision on deactivation is taken by the UIDAI headquarters. The official, however, refused to give details of the number of cards that have been deactivated.

“In most cases, we can’t trace the people after sending the notices. If we find them, we ask them to correct their address and identity proof. In rare cases we recommend deactivation,” the official added.

Sources added that UIDAI prefers not recommending too many deactivations as it reflects on its own functioning.

Officials added that there were three types of cases of false pretences – using another person’s fingerprints with the help of the operator or taking advantage of the rush during enrolment; taking advantage of Aadhaar rules which have an exception for people without fingers; providing false identity documents or address proof.

Sources added that that even in the early days of the enrolment, the authority had recommended deactivation of cards after finding some irregularities. During enquiry, even the operator who takes the biometrics and documents is questioned. Many enrolment agencies hired by UADAI in the initial days were suspended.

Title: Failed math in class 11, Hyderabad man now draws seven-digit salary
Content:
Vishal Goel

HYDERABAD: Despite failing in mathematics in class 11, Vishal Goel built a successful career in investment advisory services and is earning a seven-digit salary today.Goel, who is currently working as a partner at Cerestra Edu-Infra Fund, said that he was an average student during his school and college days. “My parents were toppers and wanted me to excel in studies. I was the only one in my family, back then, to study in a private school,” said Goel, adding his parents were shocked when he failed in maths.“My mother was teaching maths for class 11 and class 12. I was their eldest kid and there was tremendous pressure on me to score high marks,” he said, adding that ironically now he is known for being good with numbers.Goel said that as he scored a “mere” 68% in class 12 board examinations, he couldn’t get into the science stream or even into a regular day college. “All I could manage was to get enrolled in B Com at an evening college. Slowly, I started improving my performance and I could get into a regular college in the final year of the degree,” he said.Goel, an alumnus of Harvard Business School and Harvard Design School, said that things started falling into place in his final-year MBA. “I took an evening job with Ernst and Young and was paid about Rs 7,500 per month. There, I realised that marks do not matter. It’s all about your passion and hard work. When I left the firm in 2008, I was making a seven-digit salary,” Goel said.When he failed in class 11, Goel was worried that he would be forced to settle for a mediocre life and would have to forgo his dream of buying a fancy car. “Now, no one remembers or cares about my marks. Not even my parents. Back then, it was their biggest worry. But I still took it as a challenge and got a degree from Harvard to make my father happy,” he said.

Title: Local Crime Branch detains 24 trucks unloading subsidized coal at private depot
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

The coal meant for small scale industries was allegedly being unloaded at a private coal depot near Nagada whe... Read More

CHANDRAPUR: Local Crime Branch (LCB) has detained 24 coal trucks carrying subsidized coal, meant for small scale industries, but allegedly being unloaded at a private coal depot near village Nagada. Cops are investigating the links between small scale industries, Maharashtra State Mining Corporation (MSMC), and private coal barons for siphoning away subsidized coal for sale in open market.

Sources informed that MSMC allocates the monthly quota of coal to small scale industries for use at subsidized rate. This coal is supplied by different coal mines as per dispatch order, and the concerned company is meant to pick up their quota from the designated mine. It is suspected that these companies are selling their subsidized quota of coal to private players.

Hundreds of private industries get such kind of subsidized quota amounting to thousands of tonnes of coal every month. The fact that coal meant to be taken directly to the industry was being unloaded at a private depot indicates foul play, sources said.

“We had inputs in this connection and our LCB team has detained 24 trucks. We are verifying the documents and taking opinion from MSMC officials to verify if there is any foul play,” in-charge SP Prashant Khaire told TOI.

MSMC general manager Premchand Tembhare confirmed that the police have approached him for investigations. “I have asked police to take action and send me a report. Based on their report we will decide on blocking supplies and cancelling quota of coal for such companies,” he said.

LCB in-charge OP Kokate informed that their teams have detained 24 trucks carrying coal to seven different small scale units from Pavni and Govari coal mines. Three of these industries are based in Jalna, one in Aurangabad and one each in Nagpur, Yavatmal and Bhandara districts. “We have dispatched separate teams to verify if any of these industries are closed, and still lifting coal. Functioning units have been told to produce documents authenticating that all the subsidized coal taken from mines was brought to the industry and on what authority coal was unloaded at a private depot. We have also asked MSME to look into other technicalities in operation and give their say in the matter,” he said.

Sources claimed that it could be a big racket under which thousands of tonnes of coal every month is lifted at subsidized rate for small scale industries across the state and sold in open market at higher rate.

Title: 13-year-old boy lost his hand in freak accident
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Agra: In a freak accident on Tuesday, a 13-year-old boy lost his hand in a series of unfortunate events which involved his pet cow and a few monkeys. The boy, who has been taken to a Delhi hospital, is said to be in a critical condition.

Returning from school, the boy identified as Ansh Yadav untied his cow near the house and was about to return home. Ansh, a resident of Maitahan, had tied the cow's rope around his hand. Here, a biker coming from behind honked which scared the cow. The cow then began to run. Ansh lost his balance and grip, and fell. He was dragged for around 100 metres by the cow.

Being dragged along the road, the boy’s leg then got stuck into a car parked on the roadside and his right hand, which was already tied to the rope, was ripped off from the body. By the time local residents could come for help, a group of monkeys attacked the boy and badly injured his face.

Taking the separated hand in a polythene bag, the boy’s father Gopal Yadav rushed to the SN Medical College. Doctors at the hospital were unable to help much and the boy was taken to Delhi, later in the evening.

Local residents said the entire incident took place within a span of few seconds. Before anyone could rescue the boy, “his hand had separated from the body”.

Title: ZP education department receives over 6,500 applications for admissions
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Representative image

AURANGABAD: The Aurangabad zilla parishad by Wednesday evening received as many as 6,825 applications for the 5,043 seats reserved under the 25% RTE quota for the academic year 2020-21 in schools across the district.

With another 10 days to go for the registration process, the number of applications is all set to grow. As per official data, a total of 584 schools have registered themselves for admissions under the RTE Act for the upcoming academic year.

As per official data, a total of 1,33,498 people have so far applied for admissions for their wards across the state against the combined intake capacity of 1,15,191. A ZP education department official said the schedule of admissions under the RTE Act, including the date of carrying lucky draw and display of the selection list, would be declared by the state-level authorities in due course of time.

“Parents have become aware of the RTE and it is getting reflected in terms of good response to the registration process. We appeal to beneficiary parents/ guardians to take help of the 24 help-centres set up across the district in case any difficulties or clarification regarding the registration process,” SP Jaiswal, education officer (primary) with Aurangabad ZP, said.

In case of any query or clarification, people can contact the help centres at Maharashtra Hindi Vidyalaya (Shanagunj) on 8275681982 and 008275681982, Baliram Patil School (Cidco, N-9) on 9156436707 and 915846687), Sushiladevi Primary School (Ramnagar) on 8788353161 and 008788353161, Swami Vivekanand Academy (Chikhalthana) on 9960768474 and 8668835339, Shishu Vikas Mandir (Shreynagar) on 9511294079 and 8485044109, Saint Francis (Jalna Road) on 8329542958 and 8329542958, Cantonment Board English School on 9975637454 and 9975637454, Sboa School (HUDCO on 8484011806 and 8484011806, and MNC School (Nageshwarwadi) on 9975563685 and 9975563685.

Besides, beneficiaries can also access state-level helpline on 9158877431 or via e-mail: rtemah2020@gmail.com.

The Right of Children to Free and Compulsory Education Act or Right to Education Act (RTE) was enacted on August 4, 2009 and it describes the modalities of the importance of free and compulsory education for children the age group of between 6 and 14 under Article 21a of the Indian Constitution.

Title: Chennai: Burglars try to break into US man’s house, flee as cops arrive
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: Burglars who attempted to break into the house of a US national , who works as a music teacher in an international school in Taramani, took to their heels on Tuesday after a police team arrived at the spot minutes after being alerted.

A team from the Neelankarai police station said the four suspects abandoned their two-wheelers and escaped by scaling the compound wall at the back of the house. Surveillance camera footage is being examined to nab them.

Police said Cary, 43, a resident of Florida in the US, has been living in the rented apartment at Vettuvankeni for a decade with his wife. The couple woke up to the sound of someone breaking into their duplex home and alerted police. The abandoned bikes were found to be stolen. A case has been registered.

Title: Uttar Pradesh: Constable shoots self in barrack
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Ashutosh Mishra

VARANASI: A police constable Ashutosh Mishra (27), a resident of Banda district, committed suicide by shooting himself with the service rifle of his colleague at Mughalsarai Kotwali police station in Pt Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Nagar of Chandauli district on Wednesday.

Chandauli ASP Prem Chand said, “Constable Mishra shot himself in police station barrack. Policemen rushed on hearing the gunshot and found him lying in a pool of blood. The bullet pierced his jaw and head.”

Chandauli SP Hemant Kutiyal and senior officials rushed to police station while forensic team was summoned.

ASP Chand said, “He was resting after his duty when head constable Pradeep Pathak put his service rifle on bed and went to toilet. Mishra used the same rifle. No suicide note was found. Mishra also broke his mobile phone before committing suicide.”

“We have sought his call details record and messages to get any clue. His family has been informed,” he added. Mishra was a constable of 2016 batch.
