The officer said that their aim is that these bicycles should be brought into the mainstream for the students, who have to travel for their education purpose.

In Nashik district eight out of 15 talukas - Igatpuri, Trimbakeshwar, Peth, Surgana, Kalwan, Dindori, Baglan and Nandgaon – are included in the MVM.

During the last five years, the administration presented bicycles to 21,702 girl students from the government schools in Nashik district at the cost of Rs 6.87 crore. In the year 2019-20, the administration is planning to distribute 4,000 bicycles to the needful girl students.

“The aim is that the girls do not have to skip schools if they live in about a radius of 5 km from the schools. For all the girl students, who have to travel longer distances, the MVM has started blue-buses that pick and drop students besides running on the various routes at the times other than school-timings,” the officer said.

Title: Domestic violence case against husband
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Representative image

The Satpur police have booked a man resident of Lam Road, Vihitgaon area on the charges of domestic violence and subjecting his wife to cruelty under Section 498A of the Indian Penal Code.

The police said that as per the complaint lodged by the person’s wife, he has been harassing his wife from June 2019 to August 2019 to bring money from her parents so that he could start a business.

The complainant said that her husband also took away her gold chain and drove her out of the house. The Satpur police said that they were investigating the case.

Title: Takers for apprenticeships double in Telangana ; Hyderabad top pick
Content:
Picture used for representational purpose only

HYDERABAD: Students taking up apprenticeship in Telangana have doubled in the last one year with many companies coming forward to train students on new age technologies such as artificial intelligence, internet of things, drone technology etc.Students take up three to six months of apprenticeship in a focused area that helps them undergo on-the-job training along with academics. According to data tabled in the Lok Sabha recently, Telangana registered a 102 per cent rise with total 7,785 students having secured apprenticeship in 2019 as against 3,852 in 2018.The data indicates that almost 65 per cent of the total apprenticeships were rolled out in Hyderabad and neighbouring districts such as Rangareddy and Medchal-Malkajgiri. Of total apprenticeships, 5,123 were rolled out in Hyderabad, Rangareddy and Medchal-Malkajgiri.The rise in number of apprenticeships is attributed to introduction of new age courses in 12 national skill training institutes and greater awareness among students and industries. “To improve employability, students are now willingly opting for apprenticeships to get hands-on training in focused areas such as artificial intelligence, internet of things etc. For companies as well, apprenticeship is a platform that they offer to students to train them and absorb them in a full-time job based on performance,” said Ramana Rao, director, National Institute of Technology, Warangal.Experts attributed the rise in number of apprenticeships to smoother process introduced by the government.“Our Apprenticeship Act came into being as early as in 1987. According to it every company is regulated to have a certain percentage of apprentices. But so far, nobody was implementing it seriously and one of the primary reasons behind this was that 19 forms had to be filled to complete the process. Now, the government has brought it down to three,” said BVR Mohan Reddy, executive chairman, Cyient and head of the All India Council of Technical Education committee on new-age courses.

Title: Nashik: 2 senior citizens killed by their respective sons
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Representative image

NASHIK: Two senior citizens were murdered by their respective sons in two separate incidents in the rural Nashik over Monday and Tuesday.

In the first case registered with the Surgana police, a 60-year-old woman was killed by her son for allegedly not forcing his wife to work on the farm. While in the other case registered with Niphad police, a 73-year-old father was killed by his son for intervening during his fight with the in-laws. Both the suspects have been arrested by the respective police.

On Monday at around 6 pm, an argument sparked between 37-year-old Devidas Laxman Gavit of Satkhamb village in Surgana district with his mother Sonabai Laxman Gavit, when the latter was working in the farm.

As the argument heated up, Devidas, who was carrying an axe with him, attacked his mother with the same on her face, neck, and stomach and killed her on the spot.

As per the complaint registered by the man’s wife, Sarla said that her mother-in-law, who was under the influence of alcohol had an argument with her son for not making her wife work in the farm. Sarla said that as she used to suffer from painful menstrual periods she could not work in the field following which her mother-in-law picked an argument with her son.

Frustrated over the same, Devidas went into the farm and hacked his mother to death. Soon after getting information, the police rushed to the village and arrested Devidas on Tuesday evening.

In the other case, a 73-year-old man Nivrutti Nirbhavane was killed by his son Baban Nivrutti Nirbhavane (50) in Sonewadi village in Niphad taluka on Monday at around 11 pm.

According to the complaint registered by the suspect’s elder brother Kamlesh Nivrutti Nirbhavane, the police said that they arrested Baban soon after the incident was reported to them. Police said that Baban used to constantly harass his wife over small issues. Subsequently, his wife Sarla had gone to her parents' place in Sonewadi.

As her wife didn’t return for over 15 days, Baban went to in-laws house and started arguing with his wife for not returning home. As the argument heated up, Baban charged upon his wife with the axe in his hand, when his father Nivrrutti intervened and drove his son out of the house.

In the heat of the moment, Baban struck his father’s head with the axe killing him on the spot. Baban’s brother Kamlesh immediately called up the police after which the former was arrested.

Title: ‘Be pro-active for better IAF preparedness’
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Allahabad: Air officer commanding-in-chief, Central Air Command (CAC), Air Marshal Rajesh Kumar on Wednesday exhorted the commanders to adopt a pro-active approach so as to keep operational preparedness of IAF and CAC at optimum level.

Addressing the two-day commanders’ conference, which concluded at Central Air Command (CAC), Bamrauli, on Wednesday Air Marshal Rajesh Kumar said there was the need to improve quality of life in terms of healthy and smart working environment, better standards of living with clean and green surroundings and campus.

President, AFWWA (regional), Jaya Kumar presided over a meeting of executive committee of AFWWA (regional) and presidents of AFWWA (local) of the stations under CAC.

Trophies for best medicare and dental care were awarded to AF Station, Bakshi-Ka-Talab and AF Dental Centre, Gorakhpur, respectively.

‘Best medical inspection room’ was awarded to Air Force Station, Bhowali, best play school award was bagged by AFWWA (L), Gorakhpur. Air Force School, Bamrauli, was awarded the trophy for ‘best senior secondary school’.

Title: Trump's visit: Monkey menace keeps Ahmedabad airport authorities on their toes
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

One of the langurs caught by the team at the city airport on Wednesday.

AHMEDABAD: Birds are not the only fauna keeping city airport authorities on their toes, there are also monkeys venturing on to the tarmac, delaying flights and putting take-offs and landings in jeopardy.

Thus, the airport authorities were in a quandary on how to no slip-ups during the visit by US president Donald Trump along with PM Narendra Modi on February 24. They roped in a city-based NGO and the state forest department to find a feasible solution.

“Unlike the birds, monkeys cannot be scared off by the same means for a long time. If you create noise or light firecrackers, they will be scared for a few days and then get used to it. The only way is to relocate them,” said Raag Patel, associated with the NGO that signed an MoU with the airport and the forest department.

Forest department officials stationed at the airport for past fortnight said that three cages and closed enclosures near the runway fence have been created. A survey to determine these locations took place over three days.

The monkeys are into the cages with food and are then sent to a distant location. Department officials denied that these monkeys were being released in Dahod.

“They are released in semi-arid regions within Ahmedabad district ,” said an official.

Patel said that in the past 10 days, they have caught 45-odd monkeys. “Kotarpur is natural habitat for gray langurs. They come in search of food to areas such as Sardarnagar, the cantonment and Shahibaug. The airport lies in the middle. Earlier, they would would just pass through, but have now begun started staying here, creating a problem for the authorities,” he said.

He added that their feeding due to religious beliefs in several parts of the city are also responsible for the presence of monkeys.

Will the monkey catching continue after the Trump visit? “I don’t know – but I believe it will at least for some time. Monkeys are territorial animals and this set is sent somewhere else, another group will take its place,” said Patel.

Title: HC seeks report on observation homes
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

The Telangana high court on Wednesday sought detailed reports on facilities available in government observation homes for children and the conditions prevailing in them, by April 15. The bench took note of the contents of a letter written by district and sessions judge, Karimnagar regarding the condition of observation homes and converted the letter into a PIL. TNN

Title: 60-year-old robbed of gold chain
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Representative image

NASHIK: A 60-year-old woman was robbed of 10 gm gold chain worth Rs 25,000 in the Indiranagar area of the city on Tuesday evening by an unidentified man. A complaint in this regard has been registered at the Indiranagar police station.

The incident took place at around 7.40 pm near the Guru Gobind Singh College gate. The complainant, a resident of the Indiranagar area, was walking with her husband towards a wedding lawn from the Kalanagar junction when an unidentified person riding a motorcycle approached them. The moment he got close to the woman, he snatched her chain and fled.

Police said that before the couple could note down the number of the bike, it had already disappeared in thin air.

“We are looking for clues that could lead us to the suspect. We will also check nearby CCTV cameras if required,” said police, adding that further investigation is on.

Title: Home guard held for snatching chains
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

A home guard from Maharashtra police was arrested by government railway police (GRP), after he was allegedly found involved in chain snatching cases in many railway zones.

GRP officials said that the home guard, Mohan Devrao Chavan, was arrested when he came to Nizamabad to sell stolen gold. Over 116 grams of gold and Rs 1.50 lakh cash was seized from him. TNN

Title: K-RERA orders builder to pay 15% interest of sale amount for default period
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: In its first order, Kerala real estate regulatory authority (K-RERA) asked a builder to pay interest at 15% of the amount received from the buyer covering the period starting from expiry of agreed time of delivery till handing over of the apartment. K-RERA issued the judgment after considering the complaint filed by CR Subhash against CJ’s Haritha Homes in Kottayam .

As per the complainant, he had entered into an agreement with the builder in 2014 to purchase an apartment measuring 1,167 sq ft. It was agreed that the construction would be completed with all facilities on or before December 31, 2016. The builder received an amount of Rs 49.5 lakh on the date of agreement and as per the agreement remaining sum of Rs 2.24 lakh would be given at the time of possession of the apartment. The complainant approached K-RERA citing that handover process was delayed.

The complainant sought a relief that the construction should be completed within a month (including lift and car parking) and the sale deed should be executed within 30 days by the builder on receiving the balance amount and the flat should be handed over to him. He further prayed that in case of default, he should get an amount of Rs 49.5 lakh with 12% interest from the date of agreement till realization and an amount of Rs 10 lakh as damages.

The builder contended that the complaint cannot be considered by K-RERA since the agreement was made in 2014 while Real Estate (regulation and development) Act, 2016 came into force only in 2016 and K-RERA was constituted only in January 2020.

K-RERA responded regarding validity of the complaint citing that completion certificate of the project was not obtained till date and that project was nearing completion only by June 2020 as admitted by the builder. K-RERA hence considered it as an ongoing project as per Section 3 of the Act.

It directed the builder to register the project and complete the project and take occupancy certificate within June 30, 2020 without fail. Further, it ordered that the builder shall pay interest at the rate of 15.2% for Rs 49.5 lakh starting from March 1, 2017 till the actual date of handing over the possession of the apartment. The date from which interest must be paid was calculated after the end of grace period following agreed timeline for handover. The interest was fixed as per SBI benchmark of prime lending rate plus 2%.

K-RERA, which has begun hearings on complaints, will hold next sessions on February 24 and 26. A few interim orders have been finalized considering certain complaints till date.

Title: 98% NU results out in 30 days despite exam date changes
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Nagpur: The Nagpur University has declared 98% results of the 935 winter exams in just 30 days. Just five results were declared after the 45-day deadline while two were announced after 31 days from the last paper date.

The NU exam section had undergone a change of guard with new director Prafulla Sabale taking over just at the beginning of the exam season. There were apprehensions about the section not being able to declare results on time after several reshuffle due to assembly elections, clashing of exam dates and refusal of teachers to assess answerbooks.

As on February 17, 925 results have been announced in all. Just nine results remain to be announced while one is held up because of practical marks. The pending results, including the BPharm 3rd-semester as one of the papers, was allegedly leaked.

The NU had conducted the winter exams in three phases with the first commencing from October 2 followed by October 22 and November 13. A couple of exams in the fourth phase are yet to start while results of some are under processing.

In the first phase, most number of 402 exams were held. Out of them, results of 401 were declared in 30 days while one is pending. The second phase included 159 exams of which 149 results came in 30 days, two up to 45 days and 3 after both the deadlines. Five results from this phase are undeclared.

In the third phase, 374 exams were conducted. Out of them, 368 results are out while four remained undeclared and two came after 45 days.

In several cases, the exam section faced the biggest hurdle in the form of stiff resistance from several teachers who refused to report to valuation centres. For days, the answerbooks were lying without assessment, compelling the exam section to issue show cause notices.

Acting pro-VC Vinayak Deshpande said that this is not an individual task but was made possible because of contribution from all teaching and non-teaching staff of the university. “We try to achieve the target but the volume of work is humongous. Fortunately, everyone chipped in and contributed well. There were some who initially were reluctant leading to a delayed start but we adopted tough measures to make them obilige,” he said.

Regarding the pharmacy results, he said an inquiry was conducted and the report has been submitted. “We are yet to open the report. Soon, a decision would be taken and the result would be announced,” he said.

From Oct 3 ————— 402—————401———none ———none

From Oct 22 ————— 159—————149 ———2—————3

From Nov 13 —————374—————368-———none ———2

(E: No. of exams. R1: Results declared within 30 days. R2: Results declared within 31 to 45 days. R3: Results declared after 45 days) (One result from 1st phase pending for practical marks, 5 from 2nd phase and 4 from 3rd are yet to be declared)

Title: Alternative road will lead to more wildlife casualties, Kerala tells SC
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

A scene from the NH-766 stretch passing through the Bandipur Tiger Reserve in Karnataka where night traffic ba... Read More

KOZHIKODE: Kerala has filed an additional affidavit before the Supreme Court questioning the basis of the decade-old night traffic ban on Bandipur forest stretch of NH-766 saying that the restriction was not based on sound scientific finding or recommendation from forest department or MoEF .

The affidavit said the proposed alternative route (Kutta- Gonikuppa-Hunsur) which passes through Nagarhole Tiger Reserve (NTR) in Karnataka and Tholpetty Wildlife Sanctuary in Kerala would have higher number of animal casualties than NH-766 as it passes through dense forests. The affidavit added that 250 hectares of dense forests must be destroyed if the existing state and district roads on that stretch are to be upgraded to NH standards.

When the case came before SC on August 7, 2019, it had directed MoEF to file an affidavit with suggestions as to how NH-275 and SH-90 (alternative routes through Kutta and Gonikuppa) be made equal to NH-766 which may then be closed.

Subsequently, National Tiger Conservation Authority (NTCA) filed an affidavit giving three options, including upgrading SH-90 to a four-lane way from Hunsur to Gonikuppa to Kutta with a fully elevated two-lane road along the stretch passing through NTR (8.6km) and another elevated road from Tholpetty to Kattikulam (7.5km) passing through WWS.

Alternatively, NTCA suggested upgrading SH-90 into a four-lane way with overpass for vehicles/underpass for animals through both forest stretches. As a third option, NTCA suggested upgrading SH-90 into four lanes; excluding the forest stretch passing through NTR where the road is to be maintained in the present form with automated speed-detection cameras. However, it stated that it may induce a ‘barrier effect’ which may hinder animal movement.

State government in its affidavit urged SC to lift the night traffic ban and allow an elevated highway through Bandipur stretch. It said that the argument that wildlife had adapted itself to the night-time traffic ban is an unproven claim. It said that NTCA is mandated to develop and implement strategies for managing all 50 tiger reserves in India and it hadn’t done scientific studies or sought night traffic in tiger reserves.

Title: Maharashtra PWD to seek nod of MoRTH for preparing DPR of elevated corridor
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

NASHIK: The national highway division of the state public works department (PWD) has decided to seek the approval of the Union ministry of road transport and highways ( MoRTH ) to prepare a detailed project report for the proposed elevated corridor project from Sarda Circle to Datta Mandir Chowk.

In January, the Nashik unit of the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI), which was supposed to make the DRP and implement the project, asked the state PWD (NH) to take over the project due to financial reasons.

“Although our department is under the state government, we have to get the nod from the MoRTH as funding of all our projects comes from the ministry. Unless we get the ministry’s green signal, we would not be able to kick off the process,” sources in the PWD’s national highway division said. According to the officials, the letter seeking MoRTH’s permission would soon be sent.

In 2016, Nitin Gadkari, the Union minister for road transport and highways, had announced the project and the state PWD (NH division) was assigned the work. But two years later, on local MP Hemant Godse’s request, Gadkari directed the NHAI to take over the project and implement it. Godse said he is pursuing the matter with Central and state PWD authorities.

“I met the ministry authorities about 10 days ago and discussed the matter. I have insisted that the ministry must earmark funds for the project so that the NH division of state PWD can start the groundwork. I am still confident that the project will see the light of the day,” Godse told TOI.

The estimated project cost of the 6-km flyover is about Rs 1,800 crore. Apart from the elevated four-lane corridor, there would be service roads to enter/exit the flyover. It would help Nashik city decongest the Dwarka circle area, which is the most chocked part of the city, as well as the Nashik Road area.

The stretch on which the elevated corridor is proposed witnesses bumper-to-bumper vehicular traffic during the peak hours as it connects the Mumbai-Agra highway and the Nashik-Pune Highway from Sinnar Phata.

Title: Man arrested on charge of raping 12-year-old
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Pune: The Pune police on Tuesday arrested a man on the charge of raping a 12-year-old girl by showing her an obscene video clip at his residence on January 26.

A special court on Wednesday sent the suspect in police custody remand till Monday.

The suspect and the girl and her family members are neighbours. The girl is a student of Standard VI.

Sub-inspector Sandeep Warpade said the man had lured the girl to visit his residence and showed her an obscene video clip and raped her on January 26. He threatened the girl with dire consequences and warned her not to disclose the incident to her parents.”

He said, “The incident came to light on February 13 after the girl told her mother over phone that the suspect had sexually harassed and molested her. Her mother then lodged an FIR against the suspect under relevant sections of the Indian Penal Code (IPC) and the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act.”

“We recorded the girl’s statement on Tuesday. She gave details of the act committed by the suspect. We then invoked charges of rape and unnatural offence of the Indian Penal Code against the suspect,” he added.

Title: Contracts of 13 central kitchen contractors to be cancelled: Civic chief
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Nashik: During Tuesday’s general body meeting of the Nashik Municipal Corporation (NMC), municipal commissioner Radhakrishna Game promised action against 13 erring central kitchen contractors within eight days.

He also ordered the civic administration to take charge from the executive engineer of the electric department until further notice following his alleged involvement in the LED streetlights corruption case.

During last month’s general body meeting, mayor Satish Kulkarni has issues directives to the civic chief to ensure that necessary action is taken against erring central kitchen contractors and that charge is taken from the executive engineer. However, his directives were not followed.

The issue was highlighted by the corporators, following which Kulkarni expressed grave concern and, for the second time, directed the civic chief to take all the necessary action.

After a nine-and-half-hours-long heated discussion during the meeting, it was decided that the contracts of 13 erring central kitchen contractors who were entrusted with the responsibility of providing mid-day meals to students of municipal schools under the central kitchen scheme will be cancelled.

Game assured the corporators that the civic administration would come down heavily against the contractors.

Besides LED streetlights corruption case and central kitchen contractors row, a number of other issues were discussed during the meeting. One such discussion was related to the civic administration’s proposed plans to acquire land reservations at the cost of Rs 150 crore. The proposals were expected to be tabled in the standing committee meeting scheduled for next week.

However, corporators from the opposition parties had opposed the decision of the civic administration and had sought to pay compensation of those farmers whose lands have already been acquired by the civic body decades ago. They also alleged that the farmers are yet to get compensation for their lands from the NMC.

Kulkarni directed the civic administration to table the proposals of the land acquisitions in the general body before submitting them to the standing committee for approval.

Title: Cop arrested for accepting Rs 4 lakh bribe in Phaltan
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Representative image

KOLHAPUR: A sub-inspector attached with Phaltan police station was arrested by the anti-corruption bureau (ACB) sleuths for accepting bribe of Rs 4 lakh on Tuesday.

The suspect — identified as Dnyanshwar Ashok Dalavi (33)— had demanded money from the complainant to not book his nephew in a cheating case registered at the police station. Dalavi was later produced before a local court that remanded him in two-day police custody.

According to an ACB official, Dalavi was the investigating officer of a case registered under section 420 (cheating) of the IPC related to cheating youths on the pretext of offering them government job.

During investigation, Dalavi contacted the complainant and stated that police have evidence against him. The complainant requested him not to book him in the case for which Dalavi demanded Rs 20 lakh.

However, the deal was settled at Rs 13 lakh and the complainant agreed to pay Rs 4 lakh as first instalment. Following this, the complainant lodged a complaint with the ACB.

“Following this a trap was set and when Dalavi accepted the case from the complainant, our team swung into action and caught the officer red-handed,” the officer said.

Title: Ahmedabad: Asaram Ashram to host 200 cops
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

A file photo of police at the ashram before the godman’s arrest.

AHMEDABAD: At a time when the entire government machinery has rolled out the red carpet to host US President Donald Trump, cops called from across the state, have found new host — disciples of self-styled godman Asaram at their Ashram in Motera.

Sources in the police said that around 200 cops will be staying at the Asaram Ashram for the event ‘ Namaste Trump ’ to be held in presence of Prime Minster Narendra Modi on February 24.

Police officers said around 10,000 police personnel will be deployed for the Namaste Trump event.

Asaram is serving a life sentence for a minor’s rape in Jodhpur in Rajasthan. He and his son Narayansai are facing trial in a rape case filed by two Surat sisters. The father-son duo had last year got a clean chit in deaths of two children in their ashram in 2008.

“Nearly 200 cops who will be deployed near Asaram Ashram near the cricket stadium will stay at the ashram from Thursday till the event is over,” said a police official.

DCP Zone-2, Dharmendra Sharma told TOI, “They (Ashram people) have come forward and offered arrangements for the cops.”

Sources in the Asaram Ashram said that the cops will be staying at different sheds in the ashram. “We will only provide lodging for the cops but not food,” said a disciple of Asaram.

“This is not the first time for police personnel to lodge at the ashram. Earlier, they had stayed at the ashram when bandobust for cricket matches was done,” said an Asaram disciple.

Title: Mining dept imposes hefty fines on illegal quarrying in Prakasam dist
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Amaravati: The mines department has imposed hefty penalties on granite quarry leaseholders in Prakasam district, ranging between Rs 250 crore to Rs 300 crore.

The department is also contemplating criminal action against leaseholders for excavating and transporting granite in excess of approved quantities. The department in its notices to the leaseholders said that evading seigniorage and violating approved mine plan was a serious offence.

With many of the leaseholders belonging to TDP , the tough stance by the mines department has created ripples in political circles. The government has decided to go ahead with the move as it has gathered comprehensive information about largescale illegal mining activities.

The vigilance and enforcement carried out an inquiry into illegal mining operations in Prakasam district for five months. The vigilance and enforcement wing spent several days in quarries and monitored the activities. The officials have videographed the inspection and recorded measurements in the presence of the managers of the leaseholders.

Many of the leases were either granted or renewed during the previous TDP regime. Thanks to the backing of previous government, the leaseholders made money through illegal mining activities. “We have noticed grave violations regarding approved plans in many quarries. While some of them excavated granite from unauthorized areas in the adjacent fields of the approved quarry, many went deep than the sanctioned limit. They have excavated massive quantities of stone and paid taxes for 10 percent of the stone,” said a senior official.

Sources said that the firms owned by Addanki MLA Gottipati Ravi Kumar, former minister Sidda Raghava Rao, Rajya Sabha member Garikapati Mohan Rao, who joined BJP from TDP, were among those received the notices.

“Criminal action will be initiated against the lessees under Sec. 21 (1) of MM(DR) ACR,1957 read with Rule 26(1) of APMMC Rules 1966, Rule 12(5) (h) (iii) of APMMC, 1966 for having excavated and transported granite without payment of Seigniorage fee in contravention to condition 5 of grant r/w Rule 12(5) (h) (iii) of APPMC, 1966 and under Rule 47 of Granite Conservation Development Rules, 1966 as they have conducted mining operations in gross violation of Rule 18(2), 19(1), 3l(1),37 and 41 (a) & (b) of Granite Conservation and Development Rules, 1999,” a senior official.

Title: Additional spillway work on Hirakud dam hits roadblock
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Sambalpur: Tata Projects and AGE Group of Turkey, which had been entrusted to carry out the construction work on the additional spillway of Hirakud dam, have backed out after undertaking some preliminary work, raising question mark about the project’s future.

Work on the additional spillway began in January 2019. The firms excavated around 4 lakh cubic metre soil and received a payment of Rs 12 crore against it. But recently they wrote to the state government saying they are withdrawing from the project owing to the delay by the government in handing over the site for construction work.

The project is worth Rs 369.53 crore. The firms have even started moving away personnel from the site.

Executive engineer of the spillway division, Hirakud dam, Himansu Mishra dismissed suggestion there had been delay in handing over the site for construction. “The construction firms completed the work over a patch of area, which had been handed over to them in the first phase. But they backed out from the spillway project when we handed over land for the second phase of work,” Mishra added.

He said the state government will take a decision on whether or not the contract with Tata Projects and AGE Group will be terminated and fresh tender will be floated.

Spillway a structure built in a dam to divert surplus water from a reservoir after it is filled to its capacity. The work on the additional spillway is a World Bank-funded project. The Central Water Commission (CWC) recommended enhancing the flood water discharge capacity of the dam, following which an additional spillway for Hirakud dam was proposed. Meteorological change, climate change and flooding were looked into while the decision to enhance the flood water discharge capacity was taken.

Official sources said the length of the proposed spillway will be 91 metres. There will be five sluice gates. The proposed spillway channel will originate from near Gandhi Minar on the left dyke of Hirakud reservoir and meet the river Mahanadi near Jawahar Uddyan.

At present there are 98 gates, including 64 sluice gates and 34 crest gates, to release flood water from Hirakud dam. Around 15 lakh cusec of water is released through the 98 gates at a time. However, with the construction of the additional spillway, the water discharge capacity of Hirakud dam will increase to 18 lakh cusec.

Title: JAC raises concerns over PRC tenure
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

A delegation of the Joint Action Committee of Telangana employees, gazetted officers, teachers, pensioners and workers of Telangana met chief secretary Somesh Kumar on Wednesday and said that employees were worried that extension of Professional Regulation Commission ( PRC ) tenure would delay their revised pay scales. TNN

Title: Team of 100 doctors to be posted on route
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Representative image

NASHIK: A team of 100 doctors will be deployed on the route of the Nirbhaya Marathon Run that would take place in the city on March 8, on the occasion of International Women’s Day .

A meeting of the doctors from across the city and gym trainers was conducted by the city police on Tuesday in the run-up to the Nirbhaya Marathon Run. The police said that owners and operators of private gymnasiums were also present at the meeting.

The meeting was chaired by commissioner of police Vishwas Nangare Patil. Senior doctors from the city were also present at the meeting to brainstorm on the medical issues that could crop up during the Nirbhaya Marathon Run.

During the meeting, the doctors suggested that there should be a team of 100 doctors all over the marathon route to provide immediate treatment to people.

The doctors also suggested that there should also be cardiac ambulance at a distance of every three kms along the route. The doctors appealed to the Bharat Vikas Group (BVG), that operate the ‘108 ambulance’ on call, to make maximum cardiac ambulances available.

During the meeting the doctors and the police discussed various measures to make the event successful. The police have been organising this event for the past five years.

Over the years, participants from across the district, state and country have been participating in the event. International marathoners have also taken part in the event in the previous years. The police said that the response to the event has been overwhelming and they were attempting to make it even more successful this year.

As part of the same, the police called a meeting of doctors and owners and operators of private gymnasiums to take their suggestions on organising the event successfully.

Title: Delhi Metro News: Metro snags give you blues? Your travel could be smoother in less than 2 years
Content:
File photo used for representational purpose

NEW DELHI: Delays and slow-moving trains on the Blue Line are going to be a thing of the past by the end of 2021. At least that is what Delhi Metro Rail Corporation is working at. It is upgrading the signalling system to introduce the concept of ‘virtual signals’ to reduce delays by up to 80%, having identified glitches in the 14-year-old existing signalling system as being the main cause of the snags on the corridor running from Dwarka to Noida Electronic City/Vaishali.At 65.5km, the Blue Line is one of the longest corridors in the Delhi Metro network and also the busiest with 16 lakh passengers using it daily. Usually, a glitch at any point affects train movement on the entire corridor and the slightest of delays causes massive crowding, particularly during peak hours.“The existing centralised viewing and monitoring system of Blue Line trains at the operation control centre in Metro Bhawan is more than 14 years old. At the time, the provision of ‘hot redundancy’ (system backup) did not exist since the network was small and had only a couple of interchange stations,” said Anuj Dayal, executive director (corporate communications). He said this sometimes led to the system losing train identification numbers, point flash and interlocking glitches, etc.From the signalling point of view, the corridor is divided between ‘interlocking sections’, the portion between stations where trains can change tracks. For example, both Laxmi Nagar and Anand Vihar are interlocking stations and the section between them comprising three stations — Preet Vihar, Nirman Vihar and Karkardooma — is an interlocking section. A signalling snag at any point in such a section disrupts the entire stretch. This affects movement because train operators have to acquire target speeds from each station in the manual mode. The speed is restricted to 20-25 kmph for the safety of passengers, but causes bunching of trains with a cascading effect on the entire corridor.Now, virtual signalling hopes to keep the trains operating at the normal speed of 35-37 kmph, except for a distance of 500 metres from the affected zone. “A virtual signal is an intermediate entry and exit location displayed on the signalling monitor,” explained Dayal. “It may be used, wherever required, to divide the routes between two fixed signals. It is not a physical signal and only controls trains with automatic train protection.”Dayal said that the system would be in place by end of 2021 as testing and commissioning of the system can be done only in the short period of non-revenue hours without affecting the existing signalling system. “When DMRC started Blue Line operation in 2005, there were technology constraints,” Dayal said. “To increase line capacity during failures, DMRC plans to introduce virtual signals initially on the Blue Line and subsequently on the Red (Rithala-Shaheed Sthal New Bus Adda) and Yellow (Samaypur Badli-HUDA City Centre) lines. Lines added in Phase II and Phase III adopted virtual signalling at the time of commissioning itself.”DMRC said that apart from easing movement during a signalling glitch, the focus of virtual signals would be to ensure that trains reach the nearest interchange system faster. For example, at Karkardooma interchange station in the Laxmi Nagar-Anand Vihar interlocking section, passengers other than those changing trains will also have the option of interchanging to another corridor not affected by a snag. They will be helped to take such decision through announcements in the trains.

Title: After HC order, counselling begins to fill TGT seats
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Allahabad: State secondary education department has started the process of filling up 606 posts of teachers of various subjects in government-aided secondary schools and colleges of Uttar Pradesh by recruiting candidates from waiting list.

The seats, left vacant under the Trained Graduate Teachers ( TGT ) Recruitment Examination-2013, are now being filled by selecting candidates from waiting list. Counselling for selections started from Tuesday.

The process of filling up of vacancies began after the Allahabad high court, on December 28, 2019 and January 22, 2020, ruled in favour of waitlisted candidates and ordered the director (secondary education) to fill vacant seats by recruiting candidates from waiting list.

On December 29, 2013, UP Secondary Education Service Selection Board had started recruitment process for filling up 6,028 TGT posts in government-aided secondary schools. The results were declared in 2017.

When selected candidates in many subjects did not join their respective institutions, many candidates on waiting list moved the high court with the plea that they should be recruited to fill vacant posts.

Deputy director (secondary education) Ramchet issued cut-offs for various subjects for filling up of these posts through an order issued on February 13.

“Counselling of eligible candidates, being carried out from 10am to 2pm, will continue till February 22 at the office of director (secondary education) in Allahabad,” said Ramchet.

The department held counselling for Hindi, Arts, Commerce and Physical Education on Tuesday and for Science on Wednesday.

Counselling for Urdu, English and Biology will be held on February 20, for Mathematics on February 21 and for Home Science, Social Science and Sanskrit on February 22.

Title: Guard who saved train from fire felicitated
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Rajkot: A railway guard D V Jogarajia , who saved a train from fire last week , was felicitated by divisional railway manager (DRM) Rajkot Parmeshwar Funkwal on Wednesday.

Jogarajia was on duty on February 12 at Jamvanthali station when Guwahati-Okha Express going towards Okha from Rajkot was to pass.

As the train reached to Jamvanthali station at 11:41pm Jogarajia saw smoke coming out from IIAC A1 coach. He immediately informed the loco pilot who stopped the train.

On investigation it was found that there was fire in the rubber belt which was at the bottom of the coach. The belt was removed and the train was allowed to go.

According to railway officials if the belt would not have been removed there was a possibility that the entire train could have got engulfed in fire.

Title: 1st Covid patient may go home today
Content: Thrissur: India’s first patient who was diagnosed with the novel coronavirus disease (Covid-19) is likely to be discharged on Thursday after two consecutive tests of the samples taken from her turned out to be negative.A decision on discharging her from the medical college hospital here would be made on Thursday after one more test by the experts from the National Institute of Virology, Pune.Sources at the hospital termed her condition stable and the woman was likely to be discharged on Thursday.A medical board constituted to supervise the patient and suspected cases would meet on Thursday to take a call on the patient.The patient, a medical student in China’s Wuhan—the epicentre of Covid-19—had tested positive for the virus on January 30, and has since been undergoing treatment at the hospital.Two others, who were also diagnosed with Covid-19 in Alappuzha and Kasaragod districts, were discharged earlier. The patient in Thrissur was the first to be diagnosed with the deadly virus.The man in Alappuzha who had tested positive for Covid on February 1 was discharged 12 days later, and the Kasaragod man was sent home on Sunday. He had tested positive on February 3.All three had travelled together to Kerala from China.According to medical protocol, a patient should test negative for the virus twice before being announced clear of the infection.Health department officials, meanwhile, said two persons were now under hospital-based surveillance for Covid-19 in the district, besides 174 others in home quarantine No fresh samples were sent for tests from the district on Wednesday, sources said.

Title: Metro stations to come up near LLR Hospital, Motijheel
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Kanpur Metro project site

Kanpur: Metro stations would be constructed near LLR hospital and Motijheel. Out of nine Metro stations, the biggest station will be constructed between IIT and Motijheel for which barricading has been done in Tulsi Upvan.

In the beginning, water and sewage pipes, communication lines and drainage system running underground would be shifted to enable the construction agency to carry out the work of the stations.

At present, the agency is constructing pillars between IIT-Kanpur and Kalyanpur station. So far, 27 pillars have been constructed and the work of soil piling is also being carried out by the agency, a Metro official told TOI.

After allocation of Rs 358 crore in the budget, the pace of work would continue, he added.

A total of nine stations between IIT and Motijheel are to be constructed, and the station at Motijheel would be the biggest station as it would extend from a part of Bal Udyan to Tulsi Upvan, the official said.

Title: Wednesday hottest with mercury hitting 27ºC
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Kanpur: The weather underwent a change on Wednesday with day temperature breaching 27 degrees Celsius for the first time in the ongoing month making it the hottest days of the month so far.

Tuesday night was quite cold with temperature at 8.8 degree while on Wednesday day temperature recorded was 27.4 degrees Celsius, two degree above than previous day.

Met department of CSA university said that the day temperature on Wednesday was 1.7 degrees more than normal. The day temperature has been hovering between 20 and 25 degrees since February 1.

On Monday day temperature rose to 26 degrees Celsius but there was again a fall in the mercury level the next day and it was recorded at 25 degrees.

Met stated that light to medium density clouds will cover city skies, however, there are no chances of rain. The weather will remain windy, said the met deapartment.

Title: Two cafes destroyed in fire at Varkala
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: Two cafes were gutted and two other shops were partially damaged in a major fire that broke out at Varkala beach here on Wednesday. According to sources at the Varkala fire station, the fire broke out around 3am on Wednesday.

Boatman’s Café that functioned in a building owned by Rajeev Fernandez of Kollam and Cafera Matica owned by Bindhu of Palayamkunnu are the cafes that were completely gutted in the fire.

Both cafes were located adjacent to each other near Thiruvambadi beach here. Both cafes were built of wood and thatched with palm leaves. The other shops that suffered damages in the fire are Soul of Kashmir, a curios shop owned by Shahina Mohalla of Srinagar, Kashmir and Magic Peacock, a perfume shop owned by Zacharia of Haripad.

The fire reportedly originated in Boatman’s Café. The cause of fire is yet to be known. There were three-fully filled LP gas cylinders inside the café that exploded in the fire, making it worse. It soon spread to Cafera Matico nearby and then to the other shops.

Fire and rescue personnel received the call at 3.25am and they soon rushed to the spot. Two units of fire tenders from Varkala and Attingal stations and one unit from Paravoor station in Kollam took part in the operation. It took two hours to douse the fire.

The owners of Boatman’s Café have reported an estimated loss of Rs 15 lakh in the incident. Cafera Matica suffered an estimated loss of Rs 8 lakh. This includes an imported coffee maker from Italy. Soul of Kashmir suffered a loss of around Rs 2 lakh and Magic Peacock, Rs 10,000.

In another incident, four shops that functioned in a building at Perumkulam under Attingal fire station limits were gutted in a fire that broke out in one of the shops on Wednesday afternoon. The fire broke out in the building that was co-owned by V M Basheer and Abdul Majeed. There were five shops in the building out of which four were completely gutted.

According to Attingal fire station officials, the building was too old with only shop room that survived the fire being new with a concrete roof. All other shop rooms were under a roof thatched with tiles and having wooden planks in place of shutters.

The fire broke out around 1.30pm when all the shop keepers were away for lunch.

Title: Power co suspends employee for criticising organisation online
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Hyderabad: The Southern Power Distribution Company of Telangana Ltd (TSSDPCL) suspended an employee and whistle-blower Koteswar Rao for criticising policy matters of the organisation on social media.

Rao works as an ADE in TSSDPCL. On February 4, he went live on Facebook and gave a lengthy speech alleging TSSDPCL of awarding 4,769 contract works to a single contractor – Pradeep Electricals – with enhanced rates for execution of fencing works near electrical transformers on nomination basis for Rs 30 crore.

In an order issued on February 17, TSSDPCL stated that Rao’s actions were construed as misconduct as per regulations for board employees. According to the order, he went on social media without seeking any permission from the management and criticised policy matters and certain engineers, thereby tarnishing the image of TSSDPCL.

“The undersigned hereby places D Koteswar Rao under suspension from the date of communication of this order and he shall continue to be under suspension till the conclusion of the disciplinary proceedings/termination of all proceedings relating to the charges,” read the order.

Title: Better supply sees cabbage, tomato sold at Rs 2/kg in Kolhapur
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Tomato prices which had skyrocketed earlier to 60 Rs per kg, were available at Rs 20 per 10 kg, which comes to... Read More

KOLHAPUR: The vegetable prices have dropped drastically in the Kolhapur Agriculture produce market committee due to a better supply of produce from the border areas and from the district on Wednesday.

According to the market committee officials, the main reason behind the falling of vegetable rates was due to the completion of sugarcane crushing season. The farmers have now focused their attention on the vegetables until the next season of sugarcane.

The rates of the vegetables such as cabbage at the agricultural produce market committee on Wednesday was around Rs 20 per 10 kg, which comes to paltry Rs 2 per kg, while for Brinjal it was Rs 30 per 10 kg, which comes to Rs 3 per kg. The minimum rate for Okra or ladyfinger was Rs 100 per 10 kg in the market.

Tomato prices which had skyrocketed earlier to 60 Rs per kg, were available at Rs 20 per 10 kg, which comes to as low as Rs 2 per kg on Wednesday.

Mohan Salape, secretary, Kolhapur Agriculture produce market committee, told TOI, “Well, this is the general scenario in this season and it will continue to be like this till April end. The vegetable produce from the Maharashtra-Karnataka border villages and from the district areas like Shirol are huge and it has a lot of impact on the rates.”

He added that since there is a gap in the demand-supply, the prices have fallen further. But the prices for the best quality vegetable will still fetch good prices for the farmers.

Namdev Parit, a farmer from Mhalunge village around 30 km from the city, said that they are aware of the downfall in the prices, and have no choice but to sell the produce in whatever prices they can fetch.

Title: Civic chief issues show-cause notice to 4 officials
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Kolhapur: Civic chief Mallinath Kalshetti has issued a show-cause notice to four civic officials over alleged irregularities in assessment of properties and collection of tax that have led to revenue loss for the Kolhapur Municipal Corporation (KMC).

A probe was ordered around a month ago after allegations of irregularities in the assessment of the property tax were made by several activists and corporators. A senior civic official claimed that the investigation will reach to its logical end and before taking any action against the officials notices have been issued to record their version.

Former chief property tax superintendent Diwakar Karande is among the four officials and has been shunted out a month ago. He was moved to Kolhapur Municipal Transport (KMT) as assistant manager. The remaining three officials are the property tax inspectors.

“We have found that some of the allegations are true. Many of the rented properties are kept out of the property tax ambit or they have been not assessed properly. The officials have to reply to the notice in seven days after which the action will be taken,” the official said.

According to a primary estimate, the assessment of over 3,000 properties is faulty and owners are paying less tax. The firm appointed to assess these properties is also under scanner.

The civic body has withheld the payment of over Rs 3 crore to be paid to the firm. The corporators have alleged that the surveyors of the firm are recording the lower property tax for several buildings.

“We aim to increase the revenue of the property tax department which has so far collected just 45% of the estimated tax revenue target. Action to be taken against the guilty officials has not been fixed yet. Most probably they will be suspended,” the official added.

Title: Residents fume during proof collection
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Saranya, who allegedly killed her son, at Thayyil on Wednesday; (R) Residents turned furious when she was brou... Read More

Kannur: When the 22-year-old Saranya , who allegedly killed her one-and-a-half-year-old son by throwing him on the sea wall in the early hours of Monday, was brought to the spot of the crime on Wednesday, public protest crossed all limits and it was with great difficulty that police managed the crowd.

It was around 9.30 am that Saranya, a resident of Thayyil, was brought to the spot as part of collecting evidence and she was directly taken to the sea wall where the body of her son Viyan was found.

When she started explaining how she threw him on the stones, and pointed towards the spot, a crowd of local residents turned furious and they showered all kind of swearwords and abuses.

Then she was taken to her home and there also she was almost composed but the family members were yet to cope with the reality and were in tears.

According to police, the woman was not happy with her husband and wanted to live with her lover. But the lover was not aware of the development and even when she was being interrogated, he called her, and the conversation was heard by police too. The murder plan was plotted by her only, they said.

The woman had clearly planned the murder and she had no guilty feeling about it, and hence she was a hard nut to crack, said a senior investigating official.

“Her plan was to implicate the husband in the murder and escape and she had planned everything accordingly, so we had to use psychological method to break her down and confess, after we got the scientific evidence,” said Kannur DSP PP Sadanandan, who led the investigation.

After the evidence collection, she was presented in the JFCM court (ii) here, which sent her in judicial remand for two weeks.

Title: Four including 2 students held with ganja
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Rajkot: Four persons including a medical student and a student of architecture were arrested for illegally possessing ganja (marijuana) at Pithadia toll booth near Jetpur in Rajkot on Tuesday night.

Police said from the possession of medical student Darshan Pumpania (25), student of architecture Vatsal Gajera (22), Devrajsinh Jadeja (25) and owner of a petrol pump, Meet Rawal (25), they seized 85 gram of ganja worth Rs 595.

“The accused were arrested during a vehicle checking drive in which their car was checked. The bag containing ganja was emitting stench of ganja, following which we checked it and found the contraband,” said R A Bhojani, sub-inspector with Virpur police station.

The police have also seized the car of the accused.

Title: Four more Shiv Bhojan thali centres in the city
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Kolhapur: The district administration is planning to increase the Shiv Bhojan thali centres to cater to more people in the city.

The initiative by the state government to provide lunch to poor citizens at just Rs 10 has become a big hit. At present, four centres are operating in the city. The centres open between 12 pm to 2 pm, however, the prescribed number of thali’s — 150 per centre — ends within an hour every day.

The officials claim that the new centres will come up at least at four places in the city such as CPR Hospital, Shahu Market Yard, Gangavesh KMT Bus Stop and Central Administrative Building.

Recently, the state government has increased the quota of thalis for each of these centres. The state government is paying Rs 40 per thali to the centres which have made this scheme a highly subsidised scheme.

District collector Daulat Desai said, “The demand to start Shiv Bhojan thali centres at other locations in the city is being made by the citizens. We are currently identifying new locations in the city. Already we have invited the applications from NGOs, women self-help grounds and restaurants to start the centre. The establishments should have their own space to provide thali to 25 citizens at one time. We will not compromise on the quality.”

The district office will receive and scrutinise the applications. At present, the centres are at the district collectors office, Savitribai Phule Hospital, Parikh Bridge and Mahalaxmi temple Kapiltirth Market. The applicants have to ensure that they have adequate space within 50 meters of these establishments. The foods and drugs administration (FDA) officials have been tasked to check the quality of food served at these centres.

The thali has two chapatis, one cup of vegetables, one cup of curry and one cup of rice. The photos and mobile numbers of the beneficiaries are recorded in the mobile application provided to the centre operator.

Title: Pocso court convicts man to 20 yrs’ RI in 14-day trial
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Kanpur: The specially constituted Pocso Act court, Kanpur Nagar, set a new record on Wednesday when it disposed of a case in just 14 days .

Judge Vijay Raje Sisodia sentenced accused Mohd Qasim to 20 years origorous imprisonment along with a fine of Rs 25,000 under section 6 of the Posco Act.

The court observed in its order that fifty percent of the fine amount (Rs 12,500) be given to the victim.

Special prosecutor Ganga Prasad Yadav said that the victim's mother in a report lodged with the police on January 28 had alleged that her 5-year-old daughter was a student of a school located in Saket Nagar. She said that her daughter used to go to school by a van driven by Mohd Qasim. On January 27, her daughter informed that the driver used to touch her private parts and even made physical advances.

Police filed the chargesheet in the case on February 4 and the court, after taking its cognizance, had framed charges against the driver on February 5. During the trial, the prosecution presented six witnesses while the accused presented two witnesses in his defence.

The court, after going through the evidence on record, convicted the accused accordingly on the 23rd day of the incident.

Title: Arvind Kejriwal: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal tells officials to ready action plan on 10 guarantees in a week
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Arvind Kejriwal

NEW DELHI: Within days of assuming office for the third consecutive term, chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday called his first official meeting with senior bureaucrats to prepare a detailed road map to fulfil the 10 promises made by him in the guarantee card released in the run-up to the assembly polls.

A senior Delhi government official said the chief minister had given one week to the heads of various departments to prepare the action plan along with a tentative timeline and budget requirement for each project. Kejriwal will start meeting the officials of individual departments from next week to have a detailed discussion and regular monitoring of each project.

After the meeting, Kejriwal said he did not keep any portfolio so that he could monitor the functioning of all departments. “I believe it is the responsibility of the chief minister to oversee the performance of all ministers and the operations of their departments,” he said.

On the basis of the tentative cost estimation, funds will be allocated in the 2020-21 budget, which is likely to be presented in the assembly in the third week of March. Kejriwal also made it clear that all free schemes launched during the previous tenure would continue, an official said.

The high-level meeting was attended by all cabinet ministers, Delhi chief secretary Vijay Dev and the secretaries and the heads of all departments, including education, health, home, power, transport, environment, urban development and Delhi Jal Board .

Re-elected with a huge mandate — 62 seats in the 70-member House — Kejriwal and his council of ministers took oath on Sunday. All ministers have said implementing the 10 promises is their top priority. The promises include replacing overhead electric cables with underground ones apart from providing 24-hour power supply and 200 units of free electricity; round-the-clock clean piped water to every household; quality education to all till graduation; cheap, accessible and better healthcare; strengthening public transport; reducing pollution by one-third; cleaning and beautifying Delhi; making city safer for women; providing basic infrastructure in all unauthorised colonies; and pucca houses for all slum dwellers.

After the meeting, Kejriwal said his government would work at a faster pace this time. “A significant meeting was held today where I met all ministers, secretaries and department heads to have a detailed discussion on each of the 10 guarantees of our manifesto,” he added. A senior official said the bureaucracy had “a blueprint ready and a proper plan will be put in place in the next few days”.

In the meeting, Kejriwal also thanked the bureaucracy for helping the political dispensation complete various projects in the last term and sought similar cooperation this time, said the official.

Title: K Chandrasekhar Rao wants vice-chancellors appointed in three weeks for Telangana universities
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

K Chandrasekhar Rao

HYDERABAD: State-run universities will finally get regular vice-chancellors. Chief minister K Chandrasekhar Rao on Wednesday directed senior officials to expedite the process of appointing VCs to the universities. The chief minister wanted the entire exercise completed within three weeks.

Presently, the universities are being headed by bureaucrats. The government had appointed civil servants as in-charge VCs in July last year.

The move attracted criticism from various quarters as some of the bureaucrats appointed as in-charge VCs had too many tasks to handle.

For instance, municipal administration principal secretary Arvind Kumar was appointed in-charge VC of Osmania University , the biggest state university that has many academic and affiliated college-related affairs to be taken care of on a daily basis.

KCR also directed the officials to appoint members to the executive councils immediately in the universities. A notification for appointment of VCs was issued earlier. Some of the universities which do not have a regular VC include OU, Kakatiya University, Telangana University, Palamuru University, Mahatma Gandhi University, Telugu University and Dr BR Ambedkar Open University.

Search committees constituted for the process received 984 applications. Governor Tamilisai Soundararajan, who is also chancellor of all the state universities, will take a final call on the appointment of VCs.

Title: Bangalore Airport: Flights from Kempegowda International Airport to US West Coast, other international destinations this year
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

File photo of Kempegowda International Airport

BENGALURU: Direct flights between Kempegowda International Airport ( KIA ), Bengaluru and several international destinations are expected to begin this year, including one to the US West Coast in October, which will be operated by American Airlines.

Several new services will begin operations next month. Japan Airlines has announced it will operate a daily direct flight between Bengaluru and Narita, Tokyo from March 29, 2020. This will make Bengaluru the second South Indian city after Chennai to have a direct flight to Tokyo.

On March 29, IndiGo is also expected to kick off another direct service between Bengaluru and Jeddah, which is currently serviced by two non-stop flights — IndiGo and Saudia. On March 16, IndiGo will operate an additional daily direct flight between Bengaluru and Doha, a route currently being serviced by Qatar Airways and IndiGo.

Lufthansa has announced that in April 2020, it will launch a direct service between Bengaluru and Munich (five times a week) using the A350-900 aircraft.

Japan Airlines had earlier hoped its Bengaluru-Tokyo flight will offer travellers from Bengaluru connectivity to the US West Coast and Canada via Tokyo. The announcement from American Airlines has, however, changed things.

American Airlines recently announced Bengaluru’s first direct connecting flight to the West Coast. The airline plans to operate a 285-seater Boeing 787-9 aircraft on the route. With this, passengers from Bengaluru can reach the destination in 16 hours. It’s expected to provide seamless travel options to those employed with tech firms in Bengaluru and Seattle.

Virgin Atlantic, as part of its Heathrow expansion plans, has identified Bengaluru-Heathrow as a new route, on which it will start flights after 2020.

Several new direct flights were launched last year from KIA to destinations like Addis Ababa by Ethiopian Airlines and Amsterdam by KLM Royal Dutch Airlines.

Title: Indore: Youth stabbed to death in busy Banganga area, 2 held
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Accused Aman and Rahul in police custody

INDORE: A youth was stabbed to death by two persons over an old dispute on a busy street of Banganga late on Tuesday.

The youth - Akash alias Lalla had entered into a scuffle with the accused - Aman alias Choti Solanki, resident of Ganeshdham Colony and Rahul Nath Sitole, resident of Sukhlia, four days ago during a wedding function. They had a dispute over dancing during the wedding. Since then the accused had been planning to attack him, police said.

“On Tuesday night, Aman and Rahul called Akash near Shyam Transport on Sukhliya railway crossing road to strike a compromise. When Akash came they made him consume alcohol. Thereafter, Aman attacked him with a sharp-edged weapon,” ASP Prashant Choubey said.

The duo committed the crime fearlessly in front of half a dozen people. The incident was recorded in CCTVs installed in the area. Aman could be seen holding Akash by his collar against a truck and stabbed him using a knife. He stabbed him at least ten times before attacking him on his head with blunt force.

After the accused fled the spot with the blood stained weapon, locals rushed Akash to hospital, where doctors declared him brought dead. His family was informed about the incident.

Police officials immediately started looking for the accused after they identified the accused based on the CCTV footage and talks with locals present at the spot.

Police officials immediately started looking for the accused after they identified the accused based on the CCTV footage and talks with locals present at the spot. One of the accused had a ponytail based on which he was identified as Choti by the locals.

“Choti owns two dogs. After committing the murder, he locked the dogs in the house and fled with his family members. He was, however, tracked within a few hours,” said ASP Choubey.

Police finally tracked the accused based on their mobile phone locations and arrested them.

Aman works for Rahul, who operates a tent business in the area.

Title: Loan waiver scheme: Beneficiaries list to be published on February 28
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Around 57,141 farmers were initially identified for the scheme across the district

KOLHAPUR: The list of beneficiaries of the state government’s ambitious Mahatma Jyotirao Phule Farmer Loan Waiver Scheme will be published on February 28.

According to officials of the finance and co-operation department of Kolhapur, data of around 50,600 farmers has already been uploaded online. It accounts for nearly 99% of the total beneficiaries’ data.

Amar Shinde, deputy registrar, finance and co-operation department, told TOI, “Once the list is published, farmers can reach out to the banks from where they had taken loan and will be required to review the details that they had provided to the banks while seeking the loan. Details such as Aadhaar number, loan amount, loan account number, etc. will be reviewed. If there is any mistake in it, farmers can lodge a complaint and get it resolved. On the other hand, if the information is correct, it will be verified with biometrics or one-time password (OTP) and the respective amount will be deposited in their account.”

According to Shinde, around 57,141 farmers were initially identified for the scheme across the district. However, the figure has been reduced to around 51,000, as few figures were found to be inflated from the nationalized banks and have now been corrected.

Shinde said that as per the scheme, loan of up to Rs 2 lakh taken between April 1, 2015, and March 31, 2019, and which has not been repaid till September 30, 2019, will be eligible for waiver.

In January, the state government had issued a resolution which stated that the farmers whose crop loan and restructured loan is above Rs 2 lakh will not be eligible for any benefit under the scheme.

Title: Councillor’s remark triggers uproar in RMC
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

RMC councillors from BJP, Congress exchange bitter barbs over recently passed budget on Wednesday

Rajkot: The general board meeting of Rajkot Municipal Corporation (RMC) held on Wednesday remained a stormy affair with BJP councillors and opposition Congress members exchanging bitter barbs over the recently passed budget.

The Congress also accused BJP members of insulting women councillors with their remarks. The main agenda of the general meeting was to pass the budget for 2020-21.

It all began when BJP councillor Kashyap Shukla, who was expressing his views about development work done by the ruling party, was interrupted by Congress’s Jagruti Dangar. When Dangar confronted his claims, a visibly irritated Shukla shot back saying, “You don’t have a say in your own house.” This comment enraged women councillors of the Congress who claimed that it was an insult to women. They demanded an immediate apology from Shukla, setting off a pandemonium in the meeting.

Congress also raised the issue of giving relief to the self-finance educational institutes in property tax. Leader of Opposition Vashram Sagathia and other councillors Atul Rajani, Gayatri Vaghela, Ghanshyam Jadeja, Jagruti Dangar and others rushed into the well. They sought to know from the mayor the logic behind the tax relief at a time when SFIs are collecting high fees from students.

The tax rate has also been reduced for banks, corporate companies and mobile towers. The opposition alleged that RMC was lenient in collecting the tax from government properties, but sealing the private ones.

Title: Academy for training in aeronautics
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Representative image

PUNE: The College of Engineering Pune (CoEP), in collaboration with Dassault Aviation, will open the Dassault Skill Academy in two months. The academy will provide technical skill-based training in aeronautics to students and professionals.

Nitin Karmalkar, SPPU’s vice-chancellor, said, “During India-France Knowledge Summit in France last year, an MoU was signed between French and Indian counterparts. Dassault Aviation, which made Rafale fighter aircraft, signed an MoU with CoEP to set up an academy in the aviation sector.”

CoEP director BB Ahuja said the initial process will be to take students to France for an internship in May. The academy will come up on the CoEP campus, Ahuja said.

Title: GVMC prepares for summer with Raiwada desilting plan
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Visakhapatnam: The Greater Visakhapatnam Municipal Corporation ( GVMC ) has drawn up an action plan to mitigate water supply issues in the city this summer at an estimated cost of around Rs 6.3 crore.

The civic body has proposed that desiltation work in the Raiwada canal be taken up at a cost of Rs 2.5 crore.

Earlier, the GVMC used to draw about 16-17 million gallons per day (MGD) through the canal from theRaiwada reservoir, which has now decreased to about 12 MGD due to lack of maintenance in the past decade. The GVMC now wants to close the canal for a few weeks for desilting work to improve water supply.

The GVMC has proposed setting up around 130 new borewells in various parts of the city. As part of the summer action plan, the civic body will take up the repair of existing hand borewells and the pipeline network while additional tankers will be hired to improve the supply water to tail-end areas of the city.

Speaking to TOI, an official with the GVMC said that some sandbag works will also be taken up on the riverbeds of the Sarada and the Gosthani to prevent the flow water near wells and improve the seepage capacity of infiltration galleries. “Flushing of the existing hand borewells, installation repairs, pipeline maintenance works and other miscellaneous works would also be undertaken. The hilly areas and water scarce areas are on our priority list,” said the official.

Currently, water levels in the reservoirs that supply water to the city are above normal on account of heavy rainfall in September and October 2019. At present the water level in the Yeleru reservoir, which meets a major share of the water needs of the city, stands at 83.3 meters against its full capacity of 86.5 metres, averting the need for the civic body to divert water this year from the Yeleru canal to other reservoirs as was done in 2019.

The GVMC had drawn about 350 cusecs from the Yeleru reservoir in 2018-19 to compensate for poor water levels in other reservoirs and to sustain them till the onset of the monsoon.

Of the water drawn in excess, the GVMC had pumped eight MGD water into the Meghadrigedda reservoir from the Yeleru left main canal, through the old Raiwada pumping main from November 12 to December 15, 2018.

This was further increased to 16 MGD till January 6, 2019. From January 7 to May, eight out of 16 MGD was released to the Raiwada water treatment plant while the balance eight MGD was released to the Meghadrigedda reservoir.

Title: Nirbhaya Case: Nirbhaya convict hits head against wall to hurt self
Content:
Vinay Sharma

(The victim's identity has not been revealed to protect her privacy as per Supreme court directives on cases related to sexual assault)

Read this article in Bengali

NEW DELHI: Vinay Sharma , one of the four Nirbhaya case convicts lodged in Tihar Jail number 3, allegedly injured himself by hitting his head on the wall of his cell on Monday.Jail authorities said the wardens in-charge of keeping an eye on the death row convicts managed to stop Sharma and took him to a hospital where he was given first aid and discharged.Sources said Sharma had even tried to fracture his hand by sticking it between the grilles of the cell. AP Singh, Sharma’s counsel, claimed that the incident occurred on February 16 and the convict’s mother informed him the following day when her son refused to recognise her. Singh claimed that Sharma’s mental condition had become unstable since the fresh death warrant was issued.However, jail officials said that no such indications were found during Sharma’s counselling. “He is in perfect health and responded positively to the psychometry tests conducted on him recently,” said an official.A senior officer said that since the latest death warrant was issued, the four convicts had been behaving aggressively with the jail wardens and guards. There has been a stark change in their behaviour. Though their food habits are normal, Sharma and Mukesh Singh had refused meals and eaten after much convincing.The four men have been kept on suicide watch. Wardens have been tasked to monitor the CCTV cameras installed in their well-lit cells round the clock. Guards have been placed outside their cells to keep a watch. Their interaction with other inmates have been made minimal so that no one develops sympathy for them.Though they are allowed to meet their parents, sometimes they have refused to meet them. All efforts are being made to keep them mentally alert.Sources said death row convicts sometimes act violent to cause injuries to themselves so that they can appeal for clemency. Jail officials said if a convict is found injured or underweight, the death penalty can be deferred till they turn fit.In Video: Nirbhaya convict hits head against wall to hurt self

Title: MLA & corporators urge civic body to modify proposed flyover’s landing
Content:
The Y-shaped flyover costing Rs 20 crore will be the second flyover to come up on Nehru Road

PUNE: Parvati MLA Madhuri Misal and local corporators from the Market Yard area have urged the civic authorities to modify the landing of the new Y-shaped flyover proposed in the area to streamline traffic flow.The Y-shaped flyover costing Rs 20 crore will be the second flyover to come up on Nehru Road. While one wing of the flyover will land towards Market Yard, the other will go towards Gangadham Chowk.The elected representatives held a visit to the proposed flyover site on Tuesday and urged the PMC authorities to extend the landing of one wing of the flyover up to Gangadham Chowk, which has become the busiest junction in the area.“We do not have any issues pertaining to the flyover’s landing towards Market Yard. But the wing landing in the direction of Gangadham Chowk is not suitable as it will lead to traffic chaos, considering shops of wholesale traders are located on Nehru Road, where the wing is supposed to land. Heavy vehicles will face problems while turning if the ramp of the flyover lands near the shops,” corporator Pravin Chorbele said after the site visit.He said adequate space was available near PMPML’s existing Market Yard bus stand for the landing of the flyover’s wing. “The administration should re-study the proposal and make necessary changes,” the corporator said.Parvati MLA Misal said the proposed landing of the two wings of the structure would solve the prevailing traffic problems on the stretch only partially. “The civic body should modify the proposed landing to accommodate future requirements of the area and increased vehicular traffic. Funds worth Rs 10 crore have been set aside for the flyover,” Misal said, adding that adequate funds would be made available as per requirements in the future.A delegation of Market Yard traders’ association has also made a similar suggestion to the PMC.Civic officials said they would work on the suggestions made by the elected representatives and traders’ association to work out the best feasible solution.The PMC has already started construction of a flyover on Nehru Road. The facility is landing before the Market Yard Chowk.

Title: Cops harass woman, force her not to lodge eve-teasing plaint
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Kanpur: A woman on Wednesday accused cops of misbehaving with her at Raipurwa police station when she went there with her father to lodge a complaint of harassment and eve-teasing.

Inspector general, Kanpur range, has ordered a probe into the incident.
