Title: Son’s death was not due to custodial torture: Father to HC
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Madurai: Hearing a suo motu public interest litigation (PIL) in connection with the custodial death of a youth in Madurai last year, the Madras high court has directed his father to file an affidavit after the latter expressed his desire not to pursue the case as he was convinced that the death was not due to custodial torture.

P Muthukaruppan moved the high court Madurai bench, seeking to register an FIR into the custodial death of his son, M Balamurugan. During the course of hearing, the court had directed to preserve the evidence in the case, however, Muthukaruppan withdrew the case on November 11, 2019.

After withdrawal of the petition, an advocate Henri Tiphagne in a letter to the court on November 12, indicated that the police officers are coercing Balamurugan’s parents not to depose against them.

Based on the letter, the suo motu PIL committee directed the registry to register a suo motu PIL with the prayer seeking for a direction to register the FIR and transfer the investigation to the CBI for impartial probe.

When the case was taken up for hearing on Wednesday, the counsel A Kannan representing Muthukaruppan submitted that the father had withdrawn the petition as he was convinced that his son did not die due to custodial torture. He also stated that there is no necessity to pursue this case.

However, Tiphagne wanted the court to pursue this case. He also alleged that certain transactions had taken place which was the reason behind the withdrawal of the case. Denying the allegations, the additional advocate general K Chellapandian submitted that necessary steps were taken as a case was registered in this regard and the Madurai JM III is also conducting inquiry into the case.

Taking note of the submissions, a division bench of justice M Duraiswamy and justice T Ravindran gave the direction to Muthukaruppan and adjourned the case to February 26 for further hearing.

Title: ‘Consider plea by retd sanitary worker seeking spl pension’
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Madurai: The Madras high court has directed the authorities concerned to consider a plea moved by a retired sanitary worker seeking payment of special monthly pension.

In his petition, N Balu, stated that he joined as a sanitary worker at the Thummanatham village panchayat at Usilampatti taluk in Madurai district in 1998.

After he joined duty, the panchayat officials opened a service book and periodically reviewed his service.

He was drawing a monthly salary of Rs 4,770. After working for nearly 20 years, the special officer of the village panchayat had issued a retirement order dated June 30, 2018.

He said the state had passed a government order (GO) on November 28, 2017 stating that government employees and employees working in local bodies under special time scale pay shall be granted special monthly pension and lumpsum payment (monetary benefit) at the time of retirement.

Based on the GO, the sanitary workers should be provided a special monthly pension of Rs 2,000 and lumpsum payment of Rs 50,000. Though he submitted a representation to the authorities concerned seeking the benefits, the same was not considered.

Hence, the petitioner moved the high court Madurai bench seeking special monthly pension from the date of his retirement and lumpsum payment as per the GO.

When the case was heard on Wednesday, justice M S Ramesh gave the direction to the authorities to consider the representation and pass orders in accordance with law.

Title: 16 UP govt officers fraudulently transferred land of Gond tribes: SIT
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Representative Image

LUCKNOW: A special investigation team of UP Police has named 16 government officials as those responsible for fraudulently transferring the land of Gond tribes in Umbha village of Sonbhadra to a society.

The SIT was formed after 11 members of the Gond tribe were killed by gram pradhan Yagya Dutt and his aides on July 17 last year over a land dispute. While Dutt and the henchmen were arrested, the government had formed the SIT on August 4 to investigate the case. It has completed the probe in six months.

DG SIT Rajendra Pal Singh confirmed to TOI that the report on the Umbha land dispute had been sent to the government for approval. However, he refused to divulge more details.

TOI has learnt from officers who conducted the probe that first the SIT found clinching evidence to suggest the land belonged to Gond tribals even before Independence. In 1955, the land was illegally registered in the name of Adarsh Co-operative Society.

SIT officials said 16 “public persons” were involved in fraudulently transferring the gram sabha (government) land in possession of tribal families since the pre-Independence period to a farming society. Thereafter, the land was transferred in the name of individuals and resold.

Title: No new license of stone crushers sans HC permission
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Representative image

NAINITAL: The state government on Tuesday told the Uttarakhand high court ( HC ) that it will not grant any new permission for setting up of stone crushers in the state without permission of the court.

The assurance was given by additional chief secretary (ACS) in the state government, Om Prakash, whose personal appearance was ordered by the court in its previous hearing on February 10.

The bench of Justice Sudhanshu Dhulia and Justice Narayan Singh Dhanik has been hearing a Public Interest Litigation (PIL) which said that there are over 300 stone crushers running in the state.

The petition says that these crushers are a major contributor to the pollution in the ecologically sensitive state and almost half of them are located in three districts of Udham Singh Nagar, Nainital and Haridwar .

The court’s written order — made available on Wednesday — also notes a submission made by the Bar that “at least for the three district of Haridwar, Nainital and Udham Singh Nagar, these stone crushers/screening plants can be located in a particular designated area which will be for the sole purpose of the operation of stone crushers and located at least two to three km away from residential, hospitals and religious institutions.”

Responding to the suggestion, the order read, “Since we are not aware of the logistics, we direct the state government to properly inquire and make a study of this issue… and file a report positively within a period of four weeks.”

The petitioner had pointed out that not all the plants are catering to the needs of Uttarakhand and that in fact, much of the products were being exported to other parts of the country, even as Uttarakhand was rapidly becoming a pollution zone on account of these stone crusher plants.

Title: 2004 suicide: DSP gets 4-year RI, ex-DIG gets 8 years
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

AMRITSAR: Handing out punishment in a 16-year-old case of suicide by an Amritsar family due to harassment and extortion by police and their kin, a city court sentenced a former Punjab Police DIG and four relatives of the victims to rigorous imprisonment of eight years. A DSP was given four-year RI.

On October 30, 2004, Hardip Singh , his mother Jaswant Kaur , wife Romi and sons Ismeet and Sanmeet had committed suicide at their residence by consuming poison. Former DIG Kultar Singh was Amritsar SSP when the family allegedly committed suicide, blaming the cop for forcing them to take the extreme step. The court also slapped a fine of Rs 23,000 on Kultar and four relatives of Hardip.

Title: Martin Scorsese 'eagerly waiting' for my next, claims 'Parasite' director Bong Joon Ho
Content: We will have to see how things pan out once we start shooting for films, say Gujarati filmmakers after I&B Ministry releases SOPs for film shoots

Title: Roorkee: Eight booked for duping government job aspirants
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Representative image

ROORKEE: Haridwar police have booked eight persons for duping government job aspirants on the pretext of supplying them question paper solutions in the examination hall. The accused had allegedly assured many youths that they would provide solutions to them through a bluetooth device and help them crack a competitive exam.

Police said that the gang was active in the district. The accused assured unemployed youths that they will help them clear exams for government jobs and asked for money in return. The kingpin of the gang is told to be one Mukesh Saini (42), retired Army personnel who run a career coaching institute at Gurukul Narsan under Manglaur police station jurisdiction. Saini had also been arrested in 2016 and 2018.

It is reported that Saini had taken Rs 1 lakh from one Alok Harsh for providing exam paper solution of forest guard exam on February 16. However, Harsh got no “help” from Saini. Later, he registered a complaint against Saini and others at Manglaur police station.

Police have booked Saini and seven others in the matter. "We have constituted a team under the leadership of circle officer (Laksar police) to investigate the whole matter thoroughly. No arrest has yet been made in the matter," said SSP (Haridwar) Senthil Avoodai K Raj.

Title: Police chief meets Mahila Mithra coordinators
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Vijayawada: City police commissioner Ch Dwaraka Tirumala Rao held a meeting with all the city Mahila Mithra coordinators on Wednesday.

Speaking on the occasion, Rao sought the coordinators support in raising awareness on various preventive measures for women safety in the city. He also advocated monthly meetings between Mahila Mithra volunteers and coordinators.

Addressing the gathering, Sravani, the inspector of One-Stop Centre explained that they specifically exist in offering free legal, medical and even counselling services for women and especially married women in distress.

Elsewhere, the commissioner also inaugurated another set of motorcycles for the traffic police department on Wednesday. Suzuki Motor Cycles of India Private Limited donated five new customised Suzuki Gixxer sports bikes for the traffic police as part of their corporate social responsiblity (CSR).

Rao explained that these bikes have been modified with a microphone for communication, alert siren, emergency light and control box. tnn

Title: Pay-parking done, CCP now moves to tow, clamp double-parked vehicles
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Panaji: Just days after implementing pay-parking, the Corporation of the City of Panaji (CCP) took another step to streamline traffic flow in the capital by beginning the process to clamp and tow haphazardly and illegally-parked vehicles.

The corporation is offering a seven-year contract to a private agency, which will be responsible for towing and clamping cars and motorcycles causing traffic jams, Panaji mayor Uday Madkaikar said.

Around six months earlier, Madkaikar had asked the Panaji traffic cell to penalise and clamp all haphazardly parked vehicles. At that time, the civic body provided 200 clamps to the cell.

The CCP has a truck to lift illegally parked motorcycles, but the vehicle often suffers mechanical breakdowns and the Panaji traffic cell is not adequately staffed and equipped to monitor the entire city for haphazard parking.

“The selected bidder should have well-trained workers to lift, tow and clamp defaulting vehicles, who would assist the corporation and Goa traffic police in this exercise,” Madkaikar said.

In 2015, the CCP had discontinued a similar contract with a private agency. Then mayor Shubham Chodankar said that the civic body received complaints from the public due to the high rates charged by the agency.

“In order to provide better service, the city will be divided into two zones. Zone 1 will be from Kala Academy to St Inez, Miramar, Caranzalem and Dona Paula. Zone-II will be from Kala Academy to main city area, Patto, Mala and Ribandar,” a CCP official said. Less than a week ago, the corporation rolled out its pay-parking system, charging four-wheelers Rs 20 to park on Atmaram Borkar Road and 18th June Road. For every additional hour, motorists have to shell out Rs 15.

Title: Cops reject plan to host carnival parade on main Panaji road
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Goa carnival parade

PANAJI: With just two days left for the riotous Carnival celebrations to kick-off, Goa police has shot down the proposal to hold the popular float parade on the city’s main road, prompting the Corporation of the City of Panaji (CCP) to seek an urgent meeting with the North Goa collector.

The Panaji Carnival Committee, CCP and Goa police’s traffic cell will sit down with the North Goa collector at 10am to resolve the impasse and chalk out a traffic plan for February 22 when the floats are expected to roll down from the Santa Monica jetty to Kala Academy.

“We are firm on our decision. We are not going to change,” CCP mayor Uday Madkaikar said.

The traffic cell rejected the decision to return the Carnival parade to traditional route in the city on the grounds that it would lead to traffic jams.

Last year, the parade was held along the Miramar-Dona Paula road, but the CCP decided to return to the old route.

The floats will be asked to assemble at the Santa Monica jetty while the flag off will be at the Adil Shah palace with chief minister Pramod Sawant and tourism minister Manohar Ajgaonkar expected to be in attendance.

“Carnival preparations are moving at a brisk pace and we have already started setting up the stage. We cannot change it now,” Madkaikar said.

As of now, 27 participants have come forward to put up floats for the Carnival tableau.

Aside from the VIP seating area, CCP has also decided to set up a covered seating area for tourists who wish to pay and watch the float parade, a first for the Panaji Carnival.

“Seating for 500 people is being created at a special pandal where numbered tickets priced at Rs 500 are being sold. If all the tickets get sold out, we have time to increase the seating arrangements,” CCP commissioner Sanjit Rodrigues said.

These tickets are being sold at the CCP office.

CCP has decided to put up its own float, focusing on Goa as a wedding destination. The traditional four-day festivities, samba square, will also be held this year.

“Let’s celebrate Carnival without troubling anyone. There will be tourists, outsiders, foreigners and locals,” Madkaikar said.

CCP has roped in 100 volunteers, who along with Goa police, will try to regulate the throngs that come to witness the parade.

Title: Delhi-Jeddah IndiGo flight returns after two try to open door
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Representative image

NEW DELHI: A Delhi-Jeddah IndiGo flight had to return to the Delhi airport on Tuesday night after taxiing for take-off when two passengers created a scene inside the aircraft. The passengers were agitated as their two co-passengers were not allowed to board the aircraft after losing their boarding cards.

According to sources, a group of 110 people from Srinagar were travelling via Delhi to Jeddah. Two of them lost their connecting boarding pass and were not allowed on flight 6E1741.

“While the aircraft was taxiing, the group leader demanded that the two passengers be accepted on board. The IndiGo crew tried to pacify him, but two people onboard reportedly got very agitated and tried to open the aircraft door to stop it. The captain then decided to return to the terminal where two men and three women passengers were offloaded with their three checked-in bags,” said an official.

A complete anti-sabotage drill was performed. The aircraft, which has a schedule departure time of 8.10 pm, finally took off with a delay of three hours.

An IndiGo spokesperson confirmed the incident. “Some passengers displayed unruly behaviour and were offloaded to continue flight operations. A report has been filed with the relevant authorities as per protocol,” the spokesperson said.

Read this article in Bengali

Title: Andhra Pradesh high court seeks explanation on payments to power cos
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Representative image

VIJAYAWADA: The Andhra Pradesh high court on Wednesday sought explanation within two weeks regarding payments to renewable power generation companies.

Power generation companies moved the high court seeking directions to power utilities to clear dues in power bought by discoms in compliance with the earlier order of the high court.

The counsel for the energy department told the court that they had cleared all dues in compliance with the high court order and there were no pending dues in some petitions and in some cases, the state government has been trying to raise funds through bank loans to clear the dues.

As there is a huge divergence in the amount claimed by the power generation companies and the amount paid by the power utilities, the HC asked for explanation pertaining to payments to be made to individual companies.

The high court bench headed by Chief Justice J K Maheswari and Justice Ninala Jayasurya said they would summon the officials concerned for personal appearance if they failed to furnish the details.

Title: Court clean chit for 65-yr-old who ran over jaywalker
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

MUMBAI: Cautioning jaywalkers, a magistrate’s court this week acquitted a 65-year-old woman, booked in 2011 for ramming into a pedestrian at Marine Drive, after it found that he was crossing the road when the signal was green. “It is successfully brought on record that her ( Kalpana Marchant ) defence is probable that her driving was not rash but the accident took place due to rashness and sudden crossing of road on the part of deceased Sadanand Bhatde ,” the court said.

Marchant had halted after the accident near Kaivalyadham on the evening of January 22, 2011, and Bhatde was lying unconscious. Police took him to Saifee hospital, where he succumbed to injuries. Marchant was booked for rash driving and causing death by negligence.

Among the three witnesses were two cops and an eyewitness. The eyewitness told court that he was driving his car in the middle lane. He said a pedestrian crossed the road when the signal was green, and he was hit by a car from the lane on the right.

Relying on the witness, the court said he did not mention anything about the accused being rash or negligent. The court pointed out that the witness admitted that Marchant and he were driving at normal speed and the pedestrian came from the left of the road. “All these facts continuously point towards the sudden action of the victim in crossing from a place without a zebra-crossing. Such zebra-crossing is meant for crossing by pedestrians and they are only supposed to cross the road by it,” the court said.

The court said it had come on record from evidence of the eyewitness that the signal was green when the victim was crossing. “Indirectly, it suggests that the deceased was crossing the road from the place not meant for crossing, and that too when he was supposed to stop, due to having a green signal for vehicular traffic,” the court said.

“Hence, considering all the facts, it is clearly visible, but there is nothing on record to show that the accused was driving the vehicle either in a rash or negligent manner,” the court said.

Title: Narendra Modi: ‘Chai pe charcha’ with PM Modi at Hunar Haat
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

PM Modi at Hunar Haat

NEW DELHI: The Hunar Haat — a coming together of artisans from the minority communities on the lawns of Rajpath to showcase and sell their products — had a surprise guest on Wednesday afternoon. As Prime Minister Narendra Modi strode in on an unscheduled visit, both officials and minister for minority affairs Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi were caught by surprise.

As word spread that the PM was among the visitors, the crowd started growing but Modi was in no rush to leave. He obliged visitors with selfies, interacted with artisans and relished 'litti-chokha' ( a delicacy from Bihar) and 'kulhad chai’ (tea in earthen cup).

Soon after chairing the meeting of the Union cabinet Modi reached Rajpath where Hunar Haat is being organised by the ministry of minority affairs. Naqvi told TOI that the PM came at around 1.30pm and went around the Haat over the next 50 minutes. “I had returned home from the cabinet meeting chaired by the PM when I received a call from officials at Hunar Haat who said that the SPG was at the venue. I decided to go to the venue and was pleasantly surprised to see the PM arrive a few minutes later. It was very encouraging for the artisans who shared their experiences with the Prime Minister,” Naqvi said.

Interestingly, the PM chose to be like any other visitor and decided to sit on the charpai laid out near the food stalls. From the Haat’s “bawarchikhana”, the PM decided to eat litti chokha and ordered chai for himself and Naqvi and paid Rs 120 for the savoury and Rs 40 for two kulhad chai.

Artisans participating in the event came forward to tell the PM how traditional arts were dying, and events like Hunar Haat were providing them a window to sell their products.

Later the PMO put out a press statement on Modi’s visit where it shared that more than 50% of the artisans participating were women. The event will be on till February 23. Similar ‘haats’ are being organised across India as part of an effort to empower master artisans.

Title: Past perfect, future tense as hotel footfall sees sharp drop
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Vijayawada: Hotels in Vijayawada which enjoyed a dream run for almost three years during the previous government are now struggling to make ends meet as occupancy in these hotels saw a drop of about 50 per cent across all segments in the past six months. A change in regime and the present government’s alternative plans of establishing three capitals has changed the fortunes of hoteliers in the city.

When the administration completely shifted to Vijayawada from Hyderabad in 2015, the hotel industry witnessed an unprecedented demand. Vijayawada’s hotel industry saw a massive boom, especially after the city was made part of the capital.

When the previous government announced mega plans for the construction of a greenfield capital with world class infrastructure, the hospitality industry saw several new businesses mushroom in the city. More than 250 new hotels began business in the city in the past four years. Many of these hotels are in the medium range segment, offering food at affordable prices. All these hotels had good business, especially with the help of online hotel room booking mobile applications.

Speaking to TOI, Sanjay Jain, general secretary of Vijayawada hotels association, said that most of the new entrants have been struggling to make ends meet for the past six months with occupancy drastically falling by as much as 50-60 per cent across all segments. Many of these new entrants started the business by taking the buildings on rent.

With the fall in occupancy, the new hotels are in a catch-22 situation. On one hand they are not getting enough revenue for maintenance, and on the other hand, to close down the operations, they will have to forgo all the capital expenditure they have made on the building.

“While those who have been in the business for a while are sustaining by offering discounts as high as 50% to their corporate and regular clients, the new entrants are facing severe hardships with a sharp decline in footfall,” said Sanjay Jain.

Parvataneni Ravi, president of the Vijayawada hotels association observed that the previous government used to have many events—either conferences or workshops. “Apart from hosting these events, there used to also be lot of visitors from all the world, who attended these events. Under the current government, the number of such events have come down, which has affected the hotel industry. Overall economic slowdown is also a contributing factor for the fall in demand side,” Ravi said.

Title: New Parliament House likely to cost Rs 776 crore
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

NEW DELHI: The new Parliament House will be built at an estimated cost of Rs 776 crore and the total built-up area in the Parliament complex after new construction will be more than double of what it is now. While 194 trees need to be felled for the project, the government has claimed that the total green area in the complex will increase by at least 25%.

These are the details that the housing and urban affairs ministry has submitted while seeking the environmental clearance for the project.

According to the ministry’s application, the new Parliament will have facilities for a Lok Sabha , Rajya Sabha and joint sessions besides lounges.

The new Parliament building will be 50 metres tall. The application filed by the urban affairs ministry on February 12 said that the current built-up area is 44,940 sq metre and after the new construction, this will increase to nearly 1.05 lakh sq metres.

The project to be built over 8.2 acres will require about 8.61 lakh tonnes of raw material.

The ministry has also submitted that the total number of trees in the complex will increase to 632 from the present number of 250. It has claimed that the total greenbelt will increase from the current 16,136 sq metre to 20,636 sq metre.

Title: Due to stigma, private doctors not reporting HIV cases to Goa state AIDS control society
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

BATTLING PREJUDICE

PANAJI: Private doctors treating HIV/AIDS are not reporting their cases to Goa State AIDS Control Society (GSACS) despite it being mandatory to do so. Officers with the society said that this meant that people living with HIV/AIDs still faced the risk of being stigmatised if their status came to be known.

Stating that it is one of the reasons why private doctors do not share information with them, a senior GSACS official said that this was despite making it clear to the doctors that they did not have to reveal their patients’ identities.

A GSAC staffer said that though HIV/AIDS patients may not be ostracised by society or family, as was the case few years ago, they, however, do face stigma. HIV/AIDS patients are more likely to be treated last in any public health facility if their status is known, the officer said. “It is a fact. So, can you blame them for not disclosing their status. People still look at them differently,” the officer said.

This, she said, they find reflected in patients’ behaviour when it comes to their treatment. For example, one reason behind some patients under Antiretroviral Therapy (ART) not adhering to the drugs regimen prescribed to them was that they want to avoid taking medication in the presence of others or in an office environment.

“If it is required for a person on ART to take medication at certain hours, and if that timing coincides with duty hours, then the person will likely avoid taking the tablets while in office lest he or she be questioned,” the officer said.

A person runs a high risk of treatment failure if the ART drug regimen is not adhered to. These aspects are disclosed when patients are investigated to know what may have gone wrong, and there is a first or second line failure. “We do see such cases,” the officer said.

Title: More than 2,000 people take part in anti-CAA protests
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Vellore/Tirupattur: A massive crowd gathered in Muslim-majority Tirupattur to protest against the Citizenship Amendment Act ( CAA ), National Register of Citizens ( NRC ) and National Population Register ( NPR ) on Wednesday, while relatively lesser number of protesters turned up near the Vellore collector’s office.

The protesters demanded that the Tamil Nadu government pass a resolution in the assembly not to implement the CAA, NRC and NPR.

While in Vellore around 500 people participated in the protest organised near the collector’s office, more than 2,000 people from various Muslim groups and opposition cadres took part in the protest in front of the Tirupattur collector’s office. To avert untoward incidents and to prevent the protesters picketing the collector’s office, more than 1,000 police personnel were deployed near the entrance of the collector’s offices in both towns.

Addressing the gathering near the Vellore collector’s office, J Imthiyas Ahmed Rashadi, district secretary of Jama’atul Ulema, who was heading the protest, condemned Kapilkumar Saratkar, joint commissioner of police, North Chennai, for attacking people who were protesting against CAA at Washermenpet in Chennai. He demanded compensation for the kin of deceased Pasalurhaq who allegedly died in the police attack. Rashadi urged the state government to adopt a resolution against CAA, NPR and NRC immediately.

Others who spoke after Rashadi strongly criticized the AIADMK and BJP governments for their anti-secular policies.

Speaking to TOI a senior police officer on condition of anonymity said they expected more than 2,000 people to participate in the protest and had deployed around 1,000 personnel for protection headed by Vellore SP K Praveshkumar, seven DSPs and 25 inspectors. But less than 500 people took part in the protest.

Based on the request of some Muslim groups, only seven leaders of the Muslim organisations and political parties were allowed to file a petition with the Vellore collector. After handing over the petition, the protesters dispersed around 1 pm, the officer said.

Meanwhile in Tirupattur, more than 2,000 people from various Islamic groups and opposition parties gathered in front of the collector’s office and raised slogans demanding a resolution against CAA in the assembly. Members of the Tanzimul Masjid Committee, who led the anti-CAA protest, later filed a petition with Tirupattur collector M P Sivan Arul.

No untoward incidents were reported at both Vellore and Tirupattur.

Title: Two hurt during ‘treasure hunt’ in Doddipallu forest
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Vijayawada: Two youth were found grievously injured after they attempted to hunt for treasure at Doddipallu forest near Palamaner town in Chittoor district. The incident took place on Monday but came to light only on Wednesday after cops received information about five youngsters trying to enter the Doddipallu forest in search of treasure.

“The victims were identified as Ganesh, a bike mechanic, and Harish, who had minor injuries,” deputy superintendent of police Arifulla told TOI. Arifulla said that the boys, in their mid-twenties, believed in the local myth that the forest has hidden treasure. “They began digging near a tree on Sunday. After finding nothing they went home. They returned on Monday night. But this time, they noticed that someone had erected an electric fence,” Arifulla said.

Ganesh first stepped on the high voltage fence and suffered major injury on his leg. While trying to save Ganesh, Harish too suffered minor injuries, the DSP said.

They were then taken to a local government hospital by their friends and later the police was informed. Police said that they had registered a case under AP Forest Act for trespassing and are also trying to find out who laid an electric fence in the reserve forest. tnn

Title: Three dead, four hurt after speeding tractor-trolley overturns
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Representative image

BAREILLY: Three persons died and four others sustained injuries after a speeding tractor-trolley in which they were travelling turned turtle in Ughaiti area of Budaun on Wednesday.

The injured persons have been admitted to district hospital. The bodies have been sent for postmortem.

According to police, Nafees, Nasir and Afzal who were residents of Behvalpur village under Sahswan police station of Budaun were travelling in a tractor-trolley to collect woods from a nearby area. However, the speeding tractor-trolley suddenly turned turtle near Khitora village under Ughaiti police station. Police said Nasir and Afzal died on the spot while Nafees was declared dead at the hospital. Four others travelling in the tractor-trolley sustained injuries.

Station house officer, Ughaiti police station, Pramod Kumar , said, “Three people were killed after the vehicle suddenly overturned. The family members of deceased have not given any complaint so far.”

Title: Day 2: ACB unearths more apathy from town planning officials
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Officials inspect an illegal construction site in Vijayawada on Wednesday

Vijayawada: Anti-Corruption Bureau ( ACB ) sleuths continued their state-wide raids on town planning officials for the second consecutive day on Wednesday. Officials said that they have verified different illegally constructed buildings coming under various municipal corporations and offices jurisdiction in Andhra Pradesh. Under Vijayawada Municipal Corporation (VMC) limits, officials found the unauthorised construction of a building at Central Ware House Main Road in Kedareswar Pet.

“The irregularities found here is that officials did not approve any plan. Totally unauthorised construction of G+1 commercial-cum-residential building is over 53 yards,” the ACB said. Official apathy ensued as the town planning officer neither mentioned the irregularities in the unauthorised construction register that they maintain nor was a notice served to the owner.

Overall, ACB officials inspected five more unauthorised buildings in the city, including one opposite Hindu High School in Islampet street, Kotamrajugari street, RR Appa Rao Street, Kutumba Rao street and Ganesh Nagar Colony. Not surprisingly, a majority of these are predominantly situated in One Town area. In Guntur district, officials found the unauthorised construction of one building in Nallacheruvu, with different irregularities. For another, the 3rd floor was constructed without an approved plan.

Further, setbacks were not left according to the approved plan and deviations in the use of construction. There was also excessive plinth of 198.65 sq meters. More serious irregularities under GMC limits included officials regularising a plan that was ineligible for the building penalisation scheme.

Furthermore, officials also turned a blind eye towards the deviations in the construction of buildings. Unauthorised constructions were being brazenly allowed across Nellore, Ongole, Tirupati, Tadepalligudem, Kakinada, Vizag, Srikakulam, Proddatur, Kadiri and Yemmiganur. ACB officials said that a detailed report would be submitted to the government recommending necessary actions against the erring town planning officers.

Title: Biker loses life in bid to stop SUV after being hit in Delhi
Content:
A screengrab from the video

NEW DELHI: In a shocking incident, a man was crushed under the wheels of an SUV while he was trying to stop the vehicle that was fleeing after hitting his motorbike near Krishna Nagar on Sunday afternoon. The incident was captured on a CCTV camera. The footage showed the 33-year-old man being dragged for almost 400 metres while he was hanging onto the door frame of the car until he fell and came under the wheels.Police say that the car has been identified and efforts are being made to nab the driver.The incident happened on Sunday morning when the victim, Pradeep Bansal, was returning from a grocery store. While he was taking a turn towards Krishna Nagar, the SUV hit Bansal’s bike from behind due to which he fell.In the footage, he is seen leaving his bike and grabbing the door frame of the car and hanging onto it, while the driver speeds ahead.A group of onlookers gathered along the roadside, but didn’t raise an alarm. The driver drove zigzag along the way due to which Bansal’s grip loosened and he fell on the road. He came under the rear wheels of the speeding SUV and got severely injured. He was taken to a hospital, but succumbed to his injuries.Bansal’s family members claimed that they recovered the CCTV footage from the area on their own and handed it over to the police. No action was being taken to track down the driver, they alleged.“Bansal’s wife had died a year back and he is now survived by a child whom he used to take care of. He used to stay with his parents and his son,” said a family member.Police, however, said that the car owner has been identified as Brijender Singh and the vehicle was registered in Ghaziabad. Singh’s family members are being quizzed to find out who was driving the car at the time of the incident.Cops registered an FIR and handed over Bansal’s body to his family members after an autopsy on Tuesday.In Video: Delhi: Biker dead after being dragged 400 metres by SUV

Title: Students back from Wuhan recall panic, thrill, and pride
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Nagpur: After more than three weeks of isolation in their hostel rooms and 17 days quarantine in India, medical students from Hubei university of science and technology in Wuhan, China, finally reached their home on Wednesday. For families of four girl students of Vidarbha, it was a grand homecoming.

“We were asked to stay back in our hostel rooms since mid-January. Chinese staff and teachers used to provide us all necessary goods. By January 23, when their New Year began, everything was shut. Metro, airport all came to a standstill,” recalled Prachi Bhalerao, a second year medical student. Prachi’s parents stay in Akola.

First batch of evacuated Indians that was allowed to go home on February 17 included four girl students from Vidarbha.

Sonali Bhoyar, who is from Gadchiroli, said people were dying daily in Wuhan. “It was a real panic to see so many deaths every day. Even if our university was taking care of us, we finally approached the Indian embassy. They were quick to act. We were evacuated in first flight that landed in Wuhan on February 1,” said Sonali.

After landing in India, these students were kept in isolation at a medical facility of Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) near New Delhi. Here, Government and armed forces made all arrangements for them.

“Under isolation, facilities like indoor gym, carom, chess, table-tennis were available for us. We had a lot of time to spend together. Many of us got new friends. ITBP doctors also became our friends for lifetime,” said Komal Jaddewar from Nanded. She reached here by Dakshin Express on Wednesday evening.

Government made post-quarantine travel arrangement also for most of these students. Those who were from New Delhi were dropped at home. Train tickets, hospital to airport drop facility were provided to others. Students said they were proud of Indian armed forces for timely evacuation and for taking very good care during the quarantine facility.

Education continues online

Even when universities are closed, these students are attending online tutorials and digital classes.

“We have already started attending digital classes. We get online video of our lectures and PPT presentations. By scanning a QR Code, we can register our attendance. So, our session will continue virtually for now,” said student Bhagyashree Uke. The facility of online examination is also available in this university in case of emergency. So there is no hurry for them to return to Wuhan.

“I am not planning to go back unless WHO declares Wuhan free from coronavirus threat and the university invites me back,” said Sonali Bhoyar.

Title: JDA plans to take legal route to get back its plots
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Jaipur: As more than 16,000 cases on its land are pending in the court, the Jaipur Development Authority ( JDA ) has expedited its legal panel to resolve the cases.

At present, JDA’s panel has 300 legal experts. Directions has been given to follow up the cases to make JDA land free from legal tangles. A senior official at JDA said, “There are cases where stay has been put on JDA’s land. As the cases needs regular follow up, directions has been given to expedite the process.”

Sources said land worth Rs 1,000 crore cannot be sold by JDA due to court cases. “The JDA is desperate to earn revenue as it has to pay approximately Rs 30 crore installments against the loan taken from National Capital Regional Planning Board for Dravyawati River and Railway over-bridge,” said a source

The JDA has taken loans totalling Rs 2,250 crore from NCRPB for the city's major projects. The JDA sought funds from the Centre for ROBs and the elevated road.

The JDA will also prepare the list of properties which has been put under the hammer several times but could not find buyers.

As the real estate sector is going through a slump and the JDA is battling to meet its targets, zone commissioners of the civic body have been asked to earn revenue if they wanted better grades in the annual confidential report (ACR).

A JDA official said, “Zone commissioners will identify the reasons why these properties did not sell. Bigger plots, which are out of reach of buyers, will be reduced in size. To earn revenue, the zones will also focus on collection of lease money.”

The civic body will also run a special auction campaign to sell its property. The JDA will also introduce lotteries to sell its unsold plots in existing housing schemes.

Title: 13 BSP leaders from Pilibhit dist join SP
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Pilibhit: As many as 13 local leaders of the Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) joined the Samajwadi Party (SP) in presence of party’s national president Akhilesh Yadav in Lucknow on Tuesday.

According to SP district president Anand Singh Yadav, around 3,000 BSP workers will be given entry in the SP in presence of party’s UP president Naresh Uttam Patel during a convention on February 23.

Talking to mediapersons here on Wednesday, former UP cabinet minister and the present state president of SP’s minority wing Riaz Ahmad said prominent among the BSP leaders who joined the SP in Lucknow included former divisional coordinator Kashi Ram Saroj, two former district presidents Balak Ram Sagar and Hari Ram Gautam and present city president Dharmendra Kumar.

Asked about the reason behind their joining the SP, Sagar said, “BSP workers are extremely disappointed by the way party chief Mayawati is functioning. Barring a few office bearers, a majority of BSP workers, more than 3,000, would join the SP in Pilibhit on February 23.”

Title: Tamil Nadu: Ex-armyman assaults 6-year-old girl
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Representative image

Title: Apartment Act to get final nod soon
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Representative image

JAIPUR: The Apartment Ownership Act has finally reached the implementation stage. After receiving and redressing objections and suggestions, the Urban Development Housing (UDH) department will issue the go-ahead notification in the next 15 days.

As only one objection was received against the Act, the department held a workshop for builders and residents’ welfare association where suggestions were sought.

Now, after incorporating their suggestions, the notification is being readied.

A senior official at UDH said, “After rules were framed, we sought objections and suggestions. As only one objection was received, a workshop was held. After detailed discussions, notification of the rules will be issued.”

Once implemented, it will give land rights to flat owners over the land on which an apartment is constructed.

The Act is need of the hour as it is mandatory for the developer to issue sub-lease to purchasers claiming their right on the land on which the apartment is constructed.

Title: Senior agriculture scientist from Guntur to head Nabard
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Chintala Govinda Rajulu

GUNTUR: Senior agriculture scientist Chintala Govinda Rajulu has been named as next chairman of National Bank for Agriculture and Rural Development ( Nabard ).

Rajulu is at present deputy managing director with Nabard in Mumbai. Banks Board Bureau (BBB) headed by retired IAS officer BP Sharma, financial services secretary Rajiv Kumar, public enterprises secretary Shailesh and RBI deputy governor N S Viswanathan recommended Rajulu’s name to the Centre. BBB said it chose Rajulu for the chairman’s post in view of his experience and service within the organisation.

A notification about the appointment will be issued shortly. Rajulu, a native of Brahmana Koduru village of Ponnur constituency in Guntur district , did his schooling from Sri Patibandla Sitaramaiah High School (SPSH) in Guntur and went on to pursue graduation in agriculture sciences from Bapatla Agriculture College in 1978. He completed the degree in 1982 and did post-graduation in seed science and technology from Indian Agriculture Research Institute (IARI) in 1986.

He joined Nabard as grade-B officer in 1985 and held several positions across the country before becoming deputy MD in 2019. Rajulu’s appointment is likely to benefit AP as he could push at least a few pending projects and loan requests from the state. In fact, the Centre has tied-up funding of Polavaram project with Nabard. Even after getting cleared from various ministries, it might take several months to get the funds from the banker. In such a situation, intervention at the highest level would help clear the funds for the prestigious project.

Title: SC: Can Nitin Gadkari come to court, explain EV policy?
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

NEW DELHI: In an unprecedented step, the Supreme Court on Wednesday requested road transport and highways minister Nitin Gadkari to come to the court and explain the government’s policy vision on curbing vehicular pollution by gradual transition from fossil fuel-based vehicles to electric ones.

A minister has never been called to the apex court and explain a policy vision or decision of the government, a task generally carried out by the attorney general, solicitor general or any of the additional solicitors general. But a bench of Chief Justice S A Bobde and Justices B R Gavai and Surya Kant said since the minister had made several statements about e-vehicles, it would be better if he came and explained.

“Could the minister come and explain the policy on introduction of e-vehicles?” the bench asked additional solicitor general Atmaram S Nadkarni. The ASG said he would convey the request to the minister.

However, Nadkarni feared that advocate Prashant Bhushan , who was arguing for expeditious conversion of public and private vehicles to electric mode from fossil fuel mode, could cross-question the minister and create an unpleasant situation.

The bench said, “We understand Bhushan to be a political person but he will not argue with the minister. If the minister has any reservations in coming to the court, then it is not a problem.”

On Bhushan’s suggestion, the bench framed four questions requiring explanation: whether all future procurement of government vehicles should be electric-run; whether charging ports should be provided in every public infrastructure/building; whether additional levy would be charged on petrol/diesel run vehicles to cross-subsidise electric vehicles; and whether all public transport should be converted to e-vehicles.

The bench said vehicular emissions had a great impact on environment, not only for the National Capital Region but for the entire country, and the issue required a focussed approach. “We consider it appropriate to consider all issues simultaneously,” it said.

On January 17, the SC had asked the Union government to detail the steps taken to implement the National Electric Mobility Mission Plan-2020, a policy decision taken in 2012 to give incentives for adoption of electric vehicles and disincentives for fossil fuel based vehicles.

Appearing for petitioner NGO ‘Centre for Public Interest Litigation’, Bhushan cited the 2015 Faster Adoption and Manufacturing of (Hybrid &) Electric Vehicles in India (FAME India) scheme, under which the government was to subsidise ‘initial cost of acquisition’ of electric vehicles.

The CPIL had said in its plea, “Though NEMMP-2020 called for an investment of Rs 14,500 crore from the government, as of 2018, the total budget allocation of government has been less than Rs 600 crore, showing government apathy.” It had said though NMMEP planned to adopt 7 million electric/hybrid vehicles, less than 0.3 million such vehicles had been adopted till 2018.

Given the slowdown in the auto industry, Gadkari had recently said there would be no deadline for transition to electric vehicles, or a ban on petrol and diesel-run vehicles. Responding to Niti Aayog’s draft guidelines that set a timeline for phasing out vehicles with internal combustion engines, Gadkari had said, “We will not set any deadline for electric mobility. A lot of state governments are procuring electric buses... the transition will happen as a natural process.”

Title: Now, college to run from Sanganer school building
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Students of Government Higher Secondary School, Sanganer, attend classes on the field due to lack of space in ... Read More

JAIPUR: The state government has issued orders to open Sanganer Government College temporarily in the building of Government Higher Secondary School , Sanganer, where already 1,961 students are enrolled. Though there are 25 classrooms in the school, many classes are held in the open ground. In class IX and XI, more than 100 students study in one classroom.

The college will be opened in the six rooms situated in the backyard of the school courtyard. According to the order issued by the higher education ministry, the college will start from this session.

A school teacher said in most of the classes, students have to sit on the floor as there is not enough space for furniture. “If we keep the furniture, only 40 students can be accommodated in a classroom. So students sit on floor. In class IX, there are three sections with 220 students.

Two sections sit in a classroom. In class XI, there are 576 students with 8 sections of humanities, science and commerce streams. Space is going be a big issue,” said the teacher.

Classes from IX to XII are held in the six classrooms which are allotted for the college. A teacher said in one room, NCC, NSS and scout centres are functioning. The State Open School centre is also operating from it.

Higher education Minister Bhanwar Singh Bhati said, “It is a temporary building and the college will be shifted after the new building comes up. However, if there is any inconvenience to school students, we will look into the matter.”

Principal Rakesh Sharma said to solve the problem of space crunch, school can be run in two shifts. “There will be space problem if both the college and the school are run simultaneously. Government can run the school in two shifts that will help in adjusting students,” he said.

Title: Duronto’s back ‘home’ after brief halt at Ajni
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Duronto’s back ‘home’

NAGPUR: Responding to sharp criticism from passengers and people’s representatives, Central Railway rolled back its decision to operate 12289-90 Nagpur-Mumbai-Nagpur Duronto Express from Ajni. The train will again operate from home platform at Nagpur station.

TOI on Wednesday had reported on the plight of passengers owing to lack of facilities at Ajni railway station . The train was shifted just because of operational convenience. The railway had to shunt the train from home platform to Ajni coaching complex where it is maintained.

Nagpur division of Central Railway said in a release on Wednesday that from Thursday (February 20), the 12290 Nagpur-Mumbai Duronto will leave from Platform 8 (home platform) while 12289 Mumbai-Nagpur train leaving from CSMT on February 20 will also terminate at Nagpur.

In a note to Central Railway DRM here, the chief passenger traffic manager (CPTM), Mumbai, said, “As passengers are facing inconvenience due to work on lift and escalator, train should be shifted to Ajni.”

“The reason mentioned in CPTM note seems frivolous. The work on installing lift and escalator is in no way a hurdle to passengers. It is the lack of proper facilities at Ajni station that bother them,” said Brijbhushan Shukla of Rail Yatri Sangh.

“This means Duronto was deliberately shifted from home platform to Ajni under the garb of washable apron work on Platform 1. There was no need to shift the train to Ajni as it has been running smoothly for a decade. If at all Ajni needs to be developed, the railways should start giving a 2-minute stoppage to important trains like Duronto here and develop amenities,” Shukla adds.

From the CPTM communication, it appears that Central Railway may restart Duronto and other passenger train operations from Ajni after work on lift and escalator is completed. The work on both is expected to be over by March. The reason doesn’t hold water as the time when Duronto departs is night time when construction activity is stalled, experts said.

Basant Kumar Shukla, general secretary of passenger rail users’ body Bharatiya Yatri Kendra (BYK), said, “The problem is not with Duronto alone. There is same experience with other trains like Ajni-Pune, Hamsafar express and others. Unless Ajni station is redeveloped by expanding it, the problem will persist.”

Former Congress corporator Tanveer Ahmed pushed for reopening one of the operational yard lines on the east side of the station for operating Duronto. Already freight trains are being moved from this side now. This line was used by the railways long ago.”

Reacting to Central Railway faux pas, Vilas Ramteke, professor with Sir JJ College of Architecture, Mumbai, who belongs to Nagpur, said, “Setting up a lift and an escalator will be a partial relief. Quick accessibility to the station is a big issue with Ajni. I stay in North Nagpur and it is easy to approach home platform. There may be many like me facing similar problem if train is operated from Ajni.”

“I welcome CR’s decision to shift the train back, which is well connected to MP and Maharashtra bus stands. Many passengers across the region travel by Duronto. When railways spent crores on home platform, why shouldn’t it be utilized for benefit of passengers,” asked Tushar Patil, an executive working in Mumbai but originally from Nagpur.

From February 9, Nagpur division of Central Railway suddenly started operating the train from Ajni for three months. Prior to this, the train was temporarily shifted to Ajni from January 8 till February 8, citing work on washable apron on Platform 1. Railway sources said the plan was to to permanently shift Duronto to Ajni.

Title: Mundhe drops garbage transfer stations plan
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Nagpur: Municipal commissioner Tukaram Mundhe has dropped the plan to develop five garbage transfer stations and transferred its allocated funds of Rs40 crore for the bio-mining project. Garbage transfer stations were planned to achieve the status of Garbage Free City.

Mundhe, who took over the charge of CEO of Smart City special purpose vehicle — Nagpur Smart and Sustainable City Development Corporation Limited (NSSCDCL) — took the decision in the meeting to review the Smart City Project on Tuesday.

Mundhe directed NSSCDCL officials to stop the ongoing tendering process for the appointment of private contractors to develop the stations.

Mundhe’s predecessor Abhijit Bangar had planned to develop one garbage transfer station in each of the ten zones. For decades, sanitary workers of Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) used to dump garbage collected from streets and roads in a given location in each area. Also, staffers of the private garbage operator used to dump garbage collected from households at the same spots. Then, big trucks used to come and take away the garbage. But the garbage used to exist at many locations across the city causing inconvenience to the people and pollution. Therefore, Bangar planned garbage transfer stations where garbage will come and systematically taken away in big trucks to Bhandewadi dumping yard. Funds of Rs40 crore from Smart City Project was sanctioned for five stations and remaining five were supposed to be developed later.

NMC sources told TOI that Mundhe directed the officials of health department to ensure no garbage is dumped and transferred directly from sanitary workers’ tubs and small vehicles into big trucks. “Mundhe might have felt shortage of funds for bio-mining which is under way and very crucial for scientific disposal of 6-8 lakh tonne garbage lying at Bhandewadi dumping yard for decades and also to free the 32-acre land,” sources said.

Considering the past experience, now Garbage Free City may not be achieved without garbage transfer stations.

Mundhe directed the officials to adopt and spread awareness about the four Rs — reduce, reuse, recycle and refuse. He meant citizens should reduce the quantum of garbage by reusing wet garbage at households itself for compost, recycle dry waste and refuse to use plastic.

As the decision was taken by board of directors of NSSCDCL, Mundhe reportedly took the decision after taking the consent of chairman Praveen Pardeshi.

Title: Nabard grants Rs 1931cr loan for Chintalapudi
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Amaravati: In a relief to the cash-starved state government, Nabard has sanctioned a loan of Rs 1,931 crore for completion of Chintalapudi Lift Irrigation Scheme in West Godavari and Krishna districts.

The short-term loan was sanctioned under the Nabard Infrastructure Development Assistance (NIDA) to AP Water Resources Development Corporation (APWRDC). The Chintalapudi lift irrigation scheme is one of the major initiatives to provide irrigation and drinking water to the areas that have not been covered under Polavaram project. tnn

Title: Taxi driver masturbates in front of DU student in Gurugram
Content:
Picture used for representational purpose only

Auto driver molests passenger

(The victim's identity has not been revealed to protect her privacy as per Supreme court directives on cases related to sexual assault)

GURUGRAM: A first-year Delhi University student had a harrowing experience while travelling alone in an Uber cab, and alleged that the driver harassed her by incessantly staring and then masturbating in front of her during the ride.The driver, 30-year-old Manoj from Hisar, has been living in Gurugram for the past few years. He was arrested but later released on bail.Terming the incident deeply upsetting, a spokesperson for Uber said, “The driver’s access to the app has been removed and we stand ready to assist law enforcement with their investigation.”In her complaint, the woman said that on Tuesday morning, she had booked a cab through the Uber app to take her from her house in Sector 51 to the Huda City Centre metro station. The driver was constantly glancing at her in the rear-view mirror, she added. After covering some distance, he started masturbating while driving, she alleged.Fearing for her safety, the woman said she kept quiet throughout the entire ride. On reaching the metro station, she said she “jumped off the cab and ran inside”.The perturbed student then immediately took an auto to return home and shared the ordeal with her father. The duo approached the women police station in Sector 50, and on the basis of the woman’s complaint, a case was registered against the driver under IPC section 354A (sexual harassment).“With the help of the car details on the app, the driver was apprehended and produced before court from where he was released on bail,” said police spokesperson Subhash Boken.This is perhaps the first time such an incident has been reported from Gurugram. Cities like Kolkata, Delhi and Bengaluru have seen a number of complaints by passengers where drivers of app-based taxi services have been accused of harassment, misbehaviour and sexual assault. In 2015, a Delhi woman had allegedly faced a similar incident, about which she had posted on Facebook, while a woman in Kolkata had claimed that she had been molested by an Uber driver.In another case, a woman was allegedly molested by an auto driver in Gurugram in the early hours of Wednesday. The woman said she had left home with her child after an argument with her husband and decided to go to her parents’ house in Chhatarpur in New Delhi.“Around 1 am, I took an auto from DLF Phase 2 market, but instead of going to Delhi, the driver took me an isolated place in DLF Phase 1 through Sikanderpur and molested me,” she alleged, adding that when she objected, the driver beat her up and threatened to kill her child. He fled when she raised an alarm.A case was registered under IPC sections 323 (voluntarily causing hurt), 354 (outraging modesty) and 506 (criminal intimidation). “We are scanning CCTV footage to identify the accused,” said ASI Praveen from DLF Phase 2 police station.In Video: Gurugram: Cab driver masturbates in front of DU student

Title: Poet slapped with Rs 1.04Cr notice by UP govt is rage on YouTube, has visited 100 cities for anti-CAA protests
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Bareilly: A rookie poet and a reluctant politician, Imran Pratapgarhi, who was recently slapped with a Rs 1.04crore show-cause notice for his alleged remarks during anti-CAA protest in Moradabad -- which he has termed a "witch hunt -- is a rage on YouTube with over 11 lakh followers, blending poetry with humour and political rhetoric to draw cheers from the crowd.

Since the introduction of the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA), Imran has been travelling extensively to talk about it and has been a part of gatherings in at least 100 cities. With a copy of Constitution in his hand, the poet encourages people to hold democratic and peaceful protests against CAA and the national register of citizens (NRC).

In Moradabad, on February 7, a large crowd assembled at Eidgah after word spread that Imran was coming. Administration and police had a tough time managing the people. Later, they decided to take the cost incurred by police for the "security" from the poet who contested the 2019 Lok Sabha election on a Congress ticket from Moradabad.

“Popularity comes with a price, but this is too much. There was no violence and Imran just called for a peaceful protest,” a supporter said. "People here have been staging protests since January 29. After the initial two days, the numbers had started depleting. On February 7, when Imran reached here, the entire Eidgah ground was packed with people, there was no space even outside the ground,” added an organizer of the event in Moradabad.

On February 14, Imran was in Gaya district of Bihar where people have been holding a sit-in at Shanti Bagh. “For me, he is undoubtedly the present-day Faiz,” said Shaqib Rahman, a MCom student in Moradabad. His latest video,in which he had protested at Delhi Police headquarters, was seen by over 18 lakh viewers. He uses ‘Pratapgarhi’ as suffix as he was born in Pratapgarh district of eastern UP. Imran started penning poems from school, and completed graduation in Hindi literature from Allahabad University. His poem ‘Madrassa’ brought him to limelight. The then Samajwadi Party government conferred the prestigious Yash Bharati award on him for his contribution in the field of poetry and literature.

Title: Jaipur: ACB names 19 more in transport bribe scam
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Middlemen who took bribes on behalf of transport inspectors

JAIPUR: Nine more transport department officials have come under the Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) net.

On Wednesday, ACB released a list of 19 more accused including nine transport inspectors in the case for seeking bribes by threatening transporters to cancel their registrations.

The agency had arrested 15 accused in the case on Monday after Sunday’s raids. The number of accused in the case have increased from 15 to 34.

The bureau has claimed to have busted a nexus of agents and some transport department officials for allegedly collecting money from transporters by threatening them.

All the accused transport officers — Babulal Meena, Rajkumar Singh, Amritpal, Mukund Rathore , SK Sharma, Chaitanya Sahay Mathur, Alim Khan, Rajiv Jain and Sukhbir Chaudhary — are posted in Jaipur except Alim Khan, who is posted in Dudu. “We have not arrested them yet. We will call them for questioning,” additional director general (ADG) ACB Dinesh MN told TOI.

While naming 19 more accused, the ACB categorically mentioned that there could be more people involved in the racket including several public servants and individuals.

Apart from transport inspectors, the ACB has named one Kalyan, a resident of Kotputli , Jagdish from Chomu and Sikar, Rajesh and Ravi from Shahjahanpur, Jaswant (a guard) from Behror and others including Mukesh, Girwar, Sheoji Kadwal, Yogesh Kumar and Rajendra Singh.

The ACB is investigating into the case to establish the links of the transport inspectors with agents, who belong to Jaipur and other nearby places such as Chomu, Shahjahanpur and Sikar.

The ACB had claimed to have found Rs1.5 crore from the possession of 15 persons already arrested during the raids.

The officials are claiming that they have enough evidence against the arrested accused.

However, the bureau is hopeful that they will get crucial information from the 19 persons who have been named in the case but they have not been arrested.

Title: Goa’s beaches accessible, but not disabled-friendly
Content:
Goa beach

PANAJI: Even as the beaches at Candolim, Calangute, Baga, Anjuna, Ashvem and Colva are accessible to persons with disabilities, none of the state’s beaches are actually disabled-friendly, said Avelino D’Sa, founding president of Disability Rights Association of Goa (DRAG).“There is no beach in Goa which is disabled-friendly,” said D’Sa.Since 2017-18, Goa Tourism Development Corporation (GTDC) has been creating infrastructure for tourists with disabilities. It has constructed smart disabled-friendly toilets and tourist information facilities.The government has spent about Rs 42 crore in developing infrastructure for the benefit of tourists with disabilities visiting beaches. D’Sa however dismisses the government’s claim.“We would like to know on what infrastructure the government has spent Rs 42 crore on,” he said.During the last session of Goa legislative assembly, the House was told that GTDC spent Rs 4.34 crore in 2017-18 , Rs 32.44 crore in 2018-19 and for 2019-20, incurred expenses to the tune of Rs 5.30 crore, towards beach infrastructure.This was in response to a question tabled by Congress legislator Aleixo Reginaldo Lourenco.In 2017-2018, GTDC had built permanent toilet blocks at Mayem Lake, near the library building at Curchorem and at Candolim beach. Also, permanent toilet blocks have been built at Baga beach, at Baga near Titos, at Anjuna parking, Morjim Khind and at Ashwem beach. In 2019-20, permanent toilet blocks were built at Keri beach, Pernem KTC bus stand, Tiracol and Morjim beach. The GTDC is yet to conduct an access audit for beaches in Goa, the House was told.In parking lots, he said even though space is earmarked for vehicles of persons with disabilities, it is always occupied by vehicles of persons who are not disabled.“Parking is not maintained. Even at tourism festivals, we do not get parking,” D’Sa said.

Title: Five od family booked for misusing money for daughter-in-law’s cancer cure
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Pilibhit: Police on Wednesday booked five members of a family for misappropriating Rs 1.5 lakh given to the husband of a 26-year-old cancer patient for her treatment by her mother, who was also beaten and molested after her daughter died.

In her complaint filed at Pilibhit-Kotwali PS, Ahmad Bi of Beni Chaudhary locality in Pilibhit city said she had given her daughter Samreen Khanam in marriage to Wasim Khan of village Chandoi under the same police station on February 21, 2014. She added that although she had given a lot as dowry, her son-in-law and his family used to thrash her daughter demanding more.

When Samreen got diagnosed with breast cancer some months ago, Wasim took Rs 1.50 lakh from Ahmad Bi for her daughter’s treatment, but instead of spending it on the treatment, bought a secondhand truck with it. After Samreen died on January 16, Wasim’s younger brother Shibu Khan approached Ahmad Bi on February 12 and demanded another Rs 50,000, claiming Wasim had borrowed the amount for Samreen’s treatment. When Ahmad Bi refused, Shibu thrashed and molested her.

SHO Shrikant Dwivedi said an FIR was lodged against Wasim, Shibu, their sisters Nazia and Ruby, and mother Mehrunnisa, under sections 406 (criminal breach of trust), 354 (assault to outrage modesty), 452 (house trespass), 323 (voluntarily causing hurt), 504 (intentional insult) and 506 (criminal intimidation).

Title: Miners’ vehicles seized in city
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Jaipur: In a first, the Jaipur Development Authority carried out a joint operation and seized vehicles of the illegal miners carrying out mining on its land. On Wednesday, along with mining department, the JDA took action against illegal mining activities being done in three kilometres of JDA-owned land in Hardhyanpura, Dayarampura, Kanota and Mangadh. Also, encroachment on government land was removed near Kalpana Nagar Yojana of JDA.

Title: House passes RGST Bill, BJP for tax cut on marble
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Jaipur: The assembly passed the Rajasthan Goods and Services Tax (Amendment) Bill 2020 (RGST) by voice vote on Wednesday.

Minister of parliamentary affairs Shanti Kumar Dhariwal introduced the bill in the House. Replying to discussion on the Bill, the minister said that only the amendments made in the GST by Parliament have been done through this Bill.

The ordinance was brought in this regard on December 28, 2019 in view of special circumstances and urgent needs. He told that GST Council has the right to add any service and appeal in it. The state government can only provide suggestions, he said

Dhariwal said since the Centre had implemented GST in a haste, it needed some rectifications. “Earlier, the cess on petrol and diesel was Rs 3 to Rs 4 which was increased to Rs 14 to Rs 15 per litre in 2014-15. Tax collection of the Centre is going to decrease by Rs 2.50 lakh crore against the target this fiscal.”

It was discussed that after the 15th Finance Commission, there has been a loss in the tax share of the state. Earlier, the state used to get 42% of tax collection. Now, the state gets 41% of the 85% of tax collection. Fifteen per cent is already reduced as cess.

BJP MLA Kiran Maheshwari said, “The government should give presentation in GST council to reduce the tax on marble. It should be brought to 5% from 18%”

BJP MLA Madan Dilwar said, “GST on Kota stone should be waived off as industry is facing a severe setback since long.”

Title: More cameras to check SMS hospital theft cases
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Representative image

JAIPUR: More CCTV cameras will be installed at Sawai Man Singh Medical College in the wake of increasing thefts in the hospital. This was decided at a meeting with police officials held at SMSMC on Wednesday.

TOI had taken up the issue of thefts in the parking lots and other areas of the hospital in its report ‘Thieves giving hard time to patients’ attendants at SMS’ on February 9.

Patients and their attendants have to remain extra cautious as thieves target vehicles at the parking lot.

Acknowledging that thieves are around, a speaker has also been installed at the parking lot which keeps alerting vehicle owners about safety of their belongings.

“City police have also identified areas and we have also identified some areas in the hospital where thieves strike regularly especially in the parking lot. Apart from installing cameras, policemen will guard such areas regularly,” said Dr DS Meena, medical superintendent, SMS Hospital . Traffic police will also install a system in the parking lot to keep a check on vehicles entering and taking exit.

The hospital administration regularly gets complaints of petty thefts, such as thieves taking away someone’s bags and other belongings. However, SMS Hospital has expressed its limitation to police for preventing such incidents as they have limited number of guards.

Moreover, they also discussed heavy movement of vehicles and parking on the roads outside the hospital causing problems for ambulances entering the hospital carrying patients.

Title: Infrastructure for Mapusa’s new bus stand before rains, says Mapusa MLA Joshua D’Souza
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

SALIGAO: In a bid to create infrastructure at the new bus stand site at Mapusa, the Goa State Infrastructure Development Corporation (GSIDC) has floated a tender of around Rs 3 crore for various works, GSIDC vice-chairman and Mapusa MLA Joshua D’Souza said on Wednesday.

The project comprises construction of drainage, toilets and a shed for visitors. Asphalting, paver installation and illumination will also be done. D’Souza told TOI that work would be taken up in a phased manner and would be completed before the monsoon. “We will send the estimate to GSIDC for scrutiny by the first week of March, and by April, the foundation stone will be laid,” he said.

Title: Home makers to executives, women taking trekking route to rejuvenation
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Mysuru: It’s a fitness regimen, stress-buster, character builder and a getaway all rolled into one. And it’s a great way to get back in touch with nature and meet people too. From home-makers to professionals, across age groups, women in Mysuru are taking to trekking like never before, turning their weekends and vacations into a rejuvenating break from the grind.

Dr Rekha V Bhat, an endocrinologist at Columbia Asia Hospital, says she heads to the hills and mountains whenever she feels “drained” by the demands of work and everyday life. “Trekking not only teaches patience and endurance, it sharpens my reflexes to focus on patients,” she says.

The 45-year-old began trekking in the Himalayas in 2010 while studying in Chandigarh. “It was a casual visit to Badrinath and Kedarnath that made a strong impression on me. And I sensed this was the beginning of a journey,” she says.

“While trekking, we have a destination and we have to make the best use of available resources to get there. My work is the same and I have to do my best to treat my patient,” says Bhat. “My profession deals with pain and suffering and this drains me out from time to time. I then head for a trek to recharge myself.”

Among her major treks, Bhat counts Chandrabadani, Tadkeshwar Mahadev, Gomukh–Tapovan, Yamunotri, Badrinath-Charanpaduka-Vasudhara falls, Muchukunda Gufa-Satopanth lake, Valley of Flowers-Hemkund Sahib, Tunganath and Dronagiri in Uttarakhand, Ahobilam in Andhra; and Kailash-Manasarovar and Muktinath-Damodar Kund in Nepal. In Karnataka, she has been to Chamundi hills and Kumara Parvatha in Dakshina Kannada.

Himalayas was a major attraction for accounts executive S Keerthana as well who has been trekking for 10 years now. “Trekking is a stress-buster and re-energiser since you feel one with nature. I have been trekking in the Himalayas which was a great experience and that kept me going,” she says. “Down south, I have trekked in Kudremukh, Thandiyandamol, Kodaikanal and Chamundi hills. Kodaikanal is my favouring destination.”

Tiger Solanki, chairman of Mysuru-based Tiger Adventure Foundation, says trekking is helping people changing their perspective on life and helps them look at the big picture. “When people working like machines go into nature’s lap and return, they are rejuvenated and work with more vigour and energy,” says Solanki, who has been trekking for more than three decades now. “Nature also teaches lessons that books don’t, especially about oneself.”

Social worker and home-maker Suma Mahesh says children should be taken on treks from an early age. “They can learn a lot from nature. Getting in touch with the environment gives you happiness,” she says. Suma has been to the Himalayas twice.

“Trekking is beneficial for all age groups,” says IT executive Deepika Hitaish who has trekked in the Himalayas and back home as well. “It is meant for everyone who loves nature, and for those who have chronic disorders including blood pressure and diabetes. Trekking is fitness without equipment. For IT executives who work on round-the-clock shifts, trekking really helps relax and de-stress,” she says.

“Instead of partying on weekends, trekking gives you so much more. It is fitness and much more. Earlier, I used to depend on my husband for everything but trekking opened up the world for me. I now run a business and don’t think twice about doing another round of Kukkarahalli lake either,” says Sumangala Danth, entrepreneur and home-maker who has been trekking for four years now.

Title: Moradabad civic body seeks residents’ feedback
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Bareilly: The Moradabad Municipal Corporation (Moradabad Nagar Nigam) has been sensitizing local residents to participate in the ‘Ease of Living Index (EoLI) and Municipal Performance Index (MPI) 2019’ under Centre’s smart city plan.

The EoLI and MPI were launched by Ministry of Housing & Urban Affairs where locals can participate in the survey by answering questions related to the city’s development in terms of road infrastructure, transport facility, traffic, law and order, by visiting website ‘https://eol2019.org/CitizenFeedback’. The EoLI and MPI were designed with an aim to assess quality of life of citizens in 100 smart cities.

Speaking to TOI on Wednesday, Moradabad municipal commissioner Sanjay Chauhan said, “Under EoLI and MPI survey, local residents can participate by simply visiting the website ‘https://eol2019.org/CitizenFeedback’ where they will be asked 25 questions regarding their city in terms of development in various fields, including road infrastructure, civic issues, waste management, traffic, transport facilities and law and order, among others. The feedback from citizens will help in better planning and management, filling the gaps in city administration and improving the liveability of cities for its citizens.”

“The more people participate in the survey and take up the questions and answers, it will be more beneficial for the city’s development as each and every feedback from the residents will be considered,” he added.

In this connection, Moradabad civic body also held a workshop at Panchayat building auditorium in the city on Wednesday in order to make people aware of the survey and encourage them to participate and help the authorities in improvising the services by taking their suggestions.

Officials said that it is a citizen perception survey and is being conducted on behalf of the ministry and carries 30% marks under the smart city project. It is an important component of the assessment exercise as it will help in directly taking perception of citizens with respect to quality of life in their city.

The survey, which is being administered online and offline, commenced of February 1, 2020 and will continue till February 29, 2020, informed officials.

Title: Raj mulls banning sale of peacock feathers
Content:
This story is from February 20, 2020

Forest and environment minister Sukhram Vishnoi informed that the state government will consider banning sale of peacock feathers as these birds are being killed for feathers.
